However, she refused to remain idle and decided to begin selling desserts, fried food, gelatin, and pork rinds to sustain her family and take care of her necessities. Socorro currently sells pork rinds and desserts. Generally, she sells the pork rinds outside a school near her house, and she sells desserts by request from her neighbors, people that she already knows, and sometimes by recommendation. Her dream is to have a location that allows her to have better sales and to be successful.

loans.use: To invest in their business

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es: La Sra. Marisabel Vive en la localidad de el Torno del departamento de Santa Cruz,  su actividad es la venta de productos para la belleza, hace dos año que se dedica a esta actividad, es decir  desde que nació su hijo, ya que el ingreso de su esposo no le alcanza para vivir adecuadamente ya que se trabaja como chofer asalariado y tubo que buscar ella una actividad, el destino del crédito es para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor de catalogo y que se encuentran en promoción , ya que en los meses de fin de año la demanda aumenta, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Marisabel lives in the town of El Torno, in the state of Santa Cruz. Her job is selling beauty products, which she has been doing for 2 years now. She started after the birth of her son, since her husband's income from his job as a chauffeur was not enough for them to live adequately. This credit will be used to purchase beauty products wholesale by catalogue and ones that they find on sale. Since the demand for these products increases in the final months of the year, she is very thankful for the support that our institution has provided her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

La señora Olga esta en su segundo ciclo en  el Banco, está muy contenta y a gusto por la ayuda que ha recibido y por las facilidades que brinda la institución. Tiene 55 años de edad, separada hace 10 años, de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos dos de los cuales viven con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado, tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de mariscos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, vende los pescados por piezas o por libras, muchas veces también compra camarones para vender por libras, lo que mas vende es el pescado albacora por libras y el bonito blanco por piezas, ella desde muy de mañana se va al mercado para comprar el mejor pescado a los comerciantes que traen de Manta. Trabaja hasta las 18h30  todos los días,  compra siempre lo necesario para vender en el día ya que cuesta dejarlo hasta el otro día en congeladores.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar pescado más que todo albacora y bonito que s lo que más ganancias le deja.
 
Su sueño es tener un frigorífico de mariscos.
texts.en:
In the Andrés De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of royal tamarinds (fruit), members of the Communal Bank of the Virgin of Guadalupe meet every two weeks.   

Mrs. Olga is in her second cycle at the Bank, and she is very happy and please for the help she has received and for the facilities the institution provides.  She is 55 years old, separated 10 years ago, and has 7 children from this relationship, two of whom live with her. 

She sells fish, and she has a small stand in the seafood market in Portoviejo city. She sells fish by the serving, or by the pound. Quite often she buys shrimp to sell by the pound. The fish she sells the most of is the albacore tuna, sold by the pound, and bonito (white tuna), which she sells by the serving. Every morning she gets up very early and goes to the market to buy the best fish the merchants bring from Manta. She works until 6:30 p.m. every day. She always buys what she can sell the same day as it costs her to leave extra in the refrigeration overnight. 

This loan is to be used to buy more the costlier albacore and bonito tuna which leaves her with the highest earnings. 

Her dream is to have a cold storage (refrigerator) for seafood.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La Sra. Celia Vive en la localidad de el Torno de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba, capital de los valles de Bolivia, desde sus diez año que se vino a vivir al departamento, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería por fin de año com o refrescos, hielo, etc., es separada, con un hijo en edad escolares, es su única fuente de ingreso, no tiene domicilio propio por lo que vive en la casa de su tía, su actividad es la venta de licores en el mercado municipal, desde que se vino a vivir a la localidad, se dedica a esta actividad  ya que en los meses de fin de año la demanda aumenta, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia lives in the town Torno in the city of Santa Cruz, and was born in the state of Cochabamba, capital of the valleys in Bolivia. She's lived in this state for 10 years. Her plan for the loan is to buy merchandise for the end of the year celebrations including sodas, drinks, ice, etc.  She is separated with one son who attends school. 

This business is her only source of income. She does not have a residence of her own, and lives in her aunt's home. Her business is selling liquor in the city market, which has been her business ever since she moved to Santa Cruz. During the months leading up to the end of the year sales business increases. She is very appreciative of the help and support this lending institution has provided her.

loans.use: To buy wholesale drinks, etc.

loans.name: Los Atlantes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Los Atlantes, y tiene este nombre por que es en honor a la cultura Tolteca que surgió en Tula.  Está ubicado en la Tula de Allende Hidalgo, Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.
La Sra. María Virginia C. es la Tesorera del grupo.  Tiene 41 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es de clase baja, y no tiene hijos.  Ella se dedica a la costura, que inicio hace 15 años.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar otra máquina, una de mejor tecnología para aumentar su producción.  Sus clientes la buscan mucho ya que cose muy bonito. Sus compañeras mencionan que la señora María Virginia es muy responsable en todos los aspectos de la vida, es muy ordenada y honesta, por tal motivo fue que la eligieron como tesorera. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se encuentra muy entusiasmada pues tendrá la nueva máquina que dará mejores acabados a sus costuras.

La Sra. Alicia Alcántara es otra integrante de este grupo.  Tiene 33 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es de clase media baja y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 4 años y utilizo su préstamo para comprar los insumos para sus tamales ya que son muy aceptados entre sus clientes.  Al momento de solicitar el crédito se encuentra muy contenta ya que podrá dar más variedad de sabor a sus tamales.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los Atlantes," and they have this name because it is in honor of the Toltec culture that arose in Tula.  This group is located in Tula de Allende Hidalgo, México.  The group is made up of 9 members. 

Mrs.. María Virginia C. is the Treasurer for the group. She is 41 years old, and studied up to high school. She is from the lower class and has no children. She is a seamstress, a profession she began 15 years ago.  She is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine, one with better technology to increase production. Her clients seek her out because she sews beautifully. Her companions mention that Mrs. María Virginia is very responsible in all aspects of her life, saying that she is very organized and honest, and for that reason they selected her as treasurer. At the time of this loan request, she is very enthusiastic about having a new machine that will give her better results with all she sews. 

Mrs. Alicia Alcántara is another member of this group. She is 33 years old, studied up until high school, is from the middle class and has two children ages 8 and 4.  For the past for years she's been selling tamales. She used this loan to buy ingredients for her tamales, which are very appreciated among her clients. At the time of this loan request, she is very happy because this will enable her to add more flavorful choices to her tamales.

loans.use: To invest in their clothing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria Vive en la localidad de el Torno, del departamento de Santa Cruz, es nacida en la Provincia Cordillera  del departamento, su actividad es la venta de pan, y también presta su servicio como limpieza y jardinería en  un restaurante, es viuda y tiene a su cargo un hijo, hace dos año que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para compra insumo para la preparación del pan de trigo, ya que cada día sube mas el precio y no tiene muchas ganancias, es por esta razón que desea comprar por cantidad azúcar, harina de trigo, levadura, etc.  tiene su propia casa la cual le dejo su difunto marido, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria lives in the area of El Torno, in the department of Santa Cruz. She was born in Cordillera province. Victoria earns her living by selling bread, and she also works as a cleaner and gardener in a restaurant. She is a widow and is raising a son. 

She has been working at her job for two years and plans to use the loan money to buy ingredients to make wheat bread. As prices are rising on a daily basis and as she doesn't earn a lot of money, Victoria wants to buy sugar, wheat flour, yeast etc. in bigger quantities.

Victoria lives in her own home which was left to her by her late husband. She is very grateful to the institution for the assistance given to her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Digna Vicenta

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Digna,  en la actualidad está separada pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos viven con ella, nos cuenta que su vida es muy dura ya que la menor de sus hijos es una niña especial la cual estudia en una escuela para discapacitados, dice que es muy duro pero que Dios sabe por qué le puso esta prueba.

Tiene un puesto de comida en la calle Julio Jaramillo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja de lunes a viernes   desde las 16h00 hasta las 23h00 y los sábados y domingos desde las 13h00 hasta las 24h00, en su trabajo le ayuda una de sus hijas. En las mañanas también compra pescado para vender por libras por su sector dice que tiene que ayudarse con lo que sea ya que tiene muchos gastos mas que todo por los estudios de sus hijos ya que los tres que están con ella estudian.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar la mitad en productos para preparar la comida que vende y para comprar pescado ya que esto le deja buenas ganancias. Es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
The partners of the Virgen de Guadalupe community bank meet every two weeks in the Andres De Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, which is known as the city of the true tamarind. This is where we meet Digna who is currently separated but who has 5 children from that relationship, 3 of whom live with her. She tells us that her life is very difficult since her youngest is a special needs child and studies in a school for the disabled. She says that it is very difficult but God knows why He tested her this way. 

She has a food stand on Julio Jaramillo street in Portoviejo. She works Monday through Friday from 4:00pm to Midnight and weekends from 3:00pm to Midnight. Her daughters help her at work. In the mornings she buys fish to sell by the pound in her neighborhood. She says she has to do whatever she can since she has lots of expenses especially related to her children's studies since all three are in school. 

She will use half the loan to buy food for her stand and the other half to buy fish since this is profitable. This is her second loan with the community bank and she likes it because of the favorable repayment terms. She dreams of her children being professionals and of having a good restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and fish

loans.name: Yhosselin Karla

texts.es: La Sra. Yhosselin Vive en la localidad de el Torno, del departamento de Santa Cruz, es nacida en la localidad, hace 2 año que se dedica a la actividad de licorería, el cual es su ingreso que le permite criar a su pequeño hijo, su es poso se dedica a trabajos eventuales de la albañilería, por falta de recurso vive en la casa de sus padres, el destino del crédito es para la compra de muebles que le faltan para que su negocio funciona mejor es una persona muy joven y trabajadora con muchas ganas de superación, su deseo es de comprarse un lotecito, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Yhosselin lives where she was born in the El Torno area in the department of Santa Cruz. For 2 years she has had a liquor store which is her main source of income and allows her to raise her young son. Her husband works as a mason. Due to their lack of resources they live in her parents' home.

The loan will be used to purchase shelves and counters so her business can run properly. She is young and hardworking with a great desire to succeed. Her dream is to buy a small lot and she is very thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Purchase shelves/counters

loans.name: Teresa Bernardina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, esta localidad se le conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Teresa tiene tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta linda relación tuvo tres hijos, ya todos mayores, una de sus hijos vive con ella. El esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta de mariscos, mientras ella vende por el sector sus productos el sale a recorrer por las afueras de la ciudad en su motocicleta y también vende en la ciudad de Tosagua, trabajan todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 16h00, compran sus productos en crucita ya que allá llega mayor cantidad de pescado y está cerca para comprar.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar pescado para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 4 años y le gusta porque las cuotas de pago son cómodas.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para acompañar a su esposo en sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey Communal Bank meets every 15 days.  This area is known for its cultural traditions and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the San Jacinto and San Clemente provinces.

Teresa is 42 years old and married.  She has three adult children, and one of them lives with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband sell seafood.  While she sells her products in the area, he travels to the outskirts of the city on his motorcycle.  He also sells in the city of Tosagua.  They work every day from 5:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  They buy their products in Crucita.  There is a greater quantity of fish there, and it is nearby. 

She will use the loan to buy fish to sell.  She has been in the communal bank for four years.  She likes it because the payments are agreeable.

Her dream is to buy a car so that she can accompany her husband on his trips.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Sedeine Ismelda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Sedeine tiene ya 4 años en el Banco Comunal, esta muy contenta y agradecida con una amiga que fue quien la llevo, ya que gracias a ella entro en el Banco y a podido hacer los créditos que le han ayudado mucho en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
 
Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta linda relación ha tenido 5 hijos aunque recuerda con tristeza que uno de ellos falleció hace ya algún tiempo.

Tiene junto a su esposo una panadería en la que trabajan todos los días desde las 4 de la mañana que se levantan a hornear el pan para que esté listo para sus clientes que son muy madrugadores y que les encanta el pan calientito, esta labor continua hasta las 20h00 que dejan la masa lista para el nuevo día,  dice que es una labor muy sacrificada pero es la que ellos saben y nadie lo hace mejor según ella, además es la que les ha dado para vivir toda su vida.

Este nuevo crédito lo quieren ocupar en comprar una parte en insumos para la preparación del pan y en unas parrillas horneadoras.
 
Su  sueño es que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, every fifteen days the Cristo Rey Communal Bank meets, this place is known for its traditions and for being a few minutes away from the two best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Mrs. Sedeine has been in the Communal Bank for 4 years and is very happy and grateful with a friend that introduced and brought her into the communal bank. She has been able to have some loans that have helped her a lot in her business and family life.

Mrs. Sedeine is 34 years old, is married and from this beautiful relationship she has had 5 children although she remembers with sadness that one died some time ago.

Mrs. Sedeine along with her husband have a bakery where they work everyday from 4 in the morning to make the bread so that it is ready when their customers arrive, who are early risers and love warm bread, they work until 8 p.m. as they leave the dough ready for the next day. Mrs. Sedeine says that it’s very hard work for them but it is what they know and nobody does it better according to her, besides it is work that has earned them a living all of their lives.

With this new loan, she wants to use to buy foodstuffs to prepare the bread and some oven grills.

Mrs. Sedeine’s dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, butter, etc./oven grills.

loans.name: Verónica Yasmina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Verónica tiene 39 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 14 años que aun estudia en el colegio,  su marido es agricultor.
 
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura tienen sembríos de maíz y maní así como también habas y habichuelas las cuales las venden en su casa o las entregan a comerciantes de la zona, el maíz lo venden una  parte en choclos (maíz tierno) a comerciantes que lo compran en su sembrío, los cuales los llevan a los mercados de la capital manabita. Trabaja en su sembrío de lunes a viernes desde las 6h30 hasta las 13h00 y los sábados y domingos se dedican  a la venta de pescado ya que como dice la vida esta muy dura y hay que ayudarse con algo más  para salir adelante.
 
Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas, abonos y fertilizantes para tener una mejor producción. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque no hay que hacer tantos trámites para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios y tenga un titulo profesional.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, every fifteen days the Cristo Rey Communal Bank meets, this place is known for its traditions and for being a few minutes away from the two best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Mrs. Verónica is 39 years old, she has a common law marriage where she has had 3 children, two are grown up and she has a lovely 14 year old daughter who is attending high school, Verónica’s husband is in agriculture.

Verónica and her husband work in agriculture and they have corn and peanut crops as well as haba beans and kidney beans which they sell in their home or to merchants in the area. The corn they sell in part as choclos (tender corn) to merchants that buy it in their land and who then sell it to markets in the capital Manabita. Verónica works in the fields Monday through Friday from 6:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. and Saturdays and Sundays they work selling fish since life is tough and they have to help themselves with other modes of income to get ahead in life.

This loan is to buy agricultural supplies, manure and fertilizers to have better crop production. Verónica has been in the communal bank for two years and she enjoys it because she doesn’t have to go through so many procedures to get loans.

Verónica’s dream is that her daughter finishes her studies and has her degree.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo  encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Gloria, tiene 28 años y está casada, de esta relación ha tenido tres hijos aunque recuerda con tristeza que el ultimo que tuvo murió cuando apenas tenía dos meses de nacido, pero Dios le dio una nueva bendición ya que se encuentra en su tercer mes de embarazo, nació en el Carmen pero ya lleva 10 años en esta linda ciudad, su esposo es taxista.

Hace algunos años ella aprendió belleza y a eso se dedica en su casa,  aunque no tiene un salón de belleza sus clientes llegan para que les realice trabajos como pintado de uñas,  cortes de cabello y tinturados, las cosas que puede hacer ya que no cuenta con los instrumentos necesarios para realizar más trabajos. También vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería) los cuales entrega en las tardes y los sábados  su esposo la lleva para que realice los cobros.

Con éste crédito quiere comprar todo lo necesario para poder instalar su salón de belleza y así poder brindar un mejor servicio. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Sus sueños es que su bebe nazca sano y tener su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo we find the Caminantes de Cristo Communal Bank which meet every fifteen days. Here we found Mrs. Gloria, she is 28 years old, is married and has three children out of this relationship, she remembers with sadness the loss of her last child that died when it was two months old but God have her a new blessing since she is in her third month of pregnancy. Gloria was born in Carmen but has lived for the last 10 years in this beautiful city, her husband is a taxi driver.

Some years ago, Gloria learned about beauty and now she does this in her home, although she doesn’t have a beauty salon, her customers come and she paints their nails, cuts and colors their hair among other things since she doesn’t have the tools to do more. Gloria also sells Yanbal products (beauty products and perfume) which she delivers in the evenings and Saturdays her husband takes her to collect the money.

With this loan, Gloria wants to buy everything necessary to set up her beauty salon and to be able to give better service to her customers. She is a founding member of her Communal Bank and enjoys the benefits that she gets from the institution.

Gloria’s dreams are that her baby is born healthy and to have her own beauty shop.

loans.use: To buy tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: EL señor Antonio D. L. C. tiene un negocio D. abarrotes denominado "Miscelánea Rio GranD." que tiene una antigüedad D. 18 años ofreciendo calidad y mejor precio. Este será su tercer crédito, al cual esta agradecido por el apoyo brindado por L. institución por que se le dio L. oportunidad D. realizar sus proyectos. Con los prestamos otorgados el ha ido prosperando y con sus ganancias del negocio desea levantar L. barda D. su casa y colocar un techo.
texts.en: Mr Antonio D. L. C. owns a grocery store called “Miscelánea Rio GranD.” that he opened 18 years ago, where he offers good quality products at good prices. This will be his third loan: he is thankful to this institution for the support provided, as this gave him the chance to achieve his projects. Thanks to the loans he has been granted he has kept on prospering, and with the earnings he gets from the shop he wants to make improvements to his house by building a security fence and a roof.

loans.use: To invest in his activity to then use part of the earnings to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio E. Hernández es un hombre profesionista y trabajador que ha dedicado su vida en una escuela preparatoria muy reconocida en la ciudad. El tiene una hija que es la mas chica de todos a la cual esta a punto de casarse y formar su propio hogar, por lo que el desea construir un cuarto independiente de la casa para ofrecerle a su hija un lugar para ella y su futuro esposo privacidad. Para esto el necesita comprar material de construcción para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Marco Antonio E. Hernández is a professional and hard-working man who engages in teaching in a very well-known preparatory school of his town. He has a beloved and lovely daughter who is about to marry and form her own family. For this reason he wants to add an independent room to his house, in order to offer his daughter a place where she and her future husband can enjoy some privacy; and to achieve his project he needs to buy some building materials.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia R. M. desde hace 8 años de dedica a la venta de ropa usada y perfumes de buena calidad que se encuentra ubicado en su misma vivienda. Este ingreso que ella percibe es para apoyar a su esposo económicamente y así cubrir sus gastos. La ropa que tiene a la venta es traída desde la ciudad donde su esposo trabaja actualmente, con las ganancias que traerá su negocio desean seguir construyendo en la parte de arriba de su vivienda.
texts.en:
For the last eight years, Mrs. Lidia R. M. has operated a business selling used clothing and quality perfumes from her home. She uses her income to supplement her husband’s earnings and cover the family expenses. 

The clothing Lidia sells is brought in from the city where her husband works. With future earnings from her business, she would like to continue the construction work on the upper floor of her house.

loans.use: Invest in used clothing and perfume business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa B. M. desde hace 1 año cuenta con un negocio denominado “Miscelánea La Pequeña” donde ofrece todo en abarrotes como lo son botanas, refrescos, leche, carnes frías y mas. En este momento ella requiere de su apoyo para comprar mercancía y ofrecer a sus clientes mejor calidad.
texts.en: María Luisa B. M. has had her business, Miscelánea La Pequeña (Small Miscellanies), for one year. The business sells all types of groceries, such as snacks, drinks, milk, lunch meats, and more. Now, she needs your help to buy merchandise and offer her customers better quality.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Blanca Bertha

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.
 
Aquí encontramos a la señora Blanca, tiene 36 años de edad de estado civil casada, de  esta relación tiene tres hijos y también crio desde muy pequeña a una hija de su esposo pero que para ella es como si fuera su hija por que la quiere igual, sus dos hijas mayores están estudiando en Universidad y los dos menores están en colegio. Su esposo es Biólogo Marino y trabaja en un laboratorio de larvas en Manta.

Tiene una tienda en la que además de vender productos de primera necesidad también vende artículos de bazar y ciertas medicinas, trabaja todos los días desde hace ya 2 años,  a las 6am   abre su tiendita y la cierra a las 19h00, no mantiene abierto muy tarde por la inseguridad que hay en todos lados prefiere cerrar temprano y evitar algún inconveniente. Sus productos los compra en Portoviejo y algunos productos los recibe en su local.

Es fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del Banco y le gusta mucho por la ayuda que recibe. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos para surtir su tienda.
 
Sus sueños son agrandar su negocio y que sus hijos sean  profesionales.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the sector known as Las Piedras, we find the Caminantes de Cristo (Followers of Christ) Communal Bank, which meets every 15 days.

Here we find Blanca. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children with her husband. She also has cared for her husband's daughter since the girl was very young, and it's as if the girl were her own daughter because she loves her equally. Her two older daughters are studying at the university and the two younger children are in school. Her husband is a marine biologist and works in a larva laboratory in Manta.

She has a store, where, in addition to selling basic-needs items, she also sells hardware and some medicine. She's been working every day for the past two years. At 6 am she opens her little store, and she closes it at 7 pm. She doesn't keep it open very late because of the insecurity there is all around. She prefers to close early and avoid something inconvenient. She buys her products in Portoviejo, and she receives some of them at home.

She is the founder of the communal bank; she is the bank treasurer, and she likes it a lot because of the help she's getting. This loan will be used to buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: Buy groceries, medicines and hardware items

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica C. es una persona muy trabajadora, cuenta con su negocio de abarrotes llamado “Angélica” desde hace 15 años y para tener más ingresos es gerente de productos por catálogo. Sus hijos ya son grandes de edad los cuales formaron su propia familia, pero ella se esta haciendo cargo de un nieto al que desea ofrecer una mejora calidad de vida. Para seguir manteniendo su negocio requiere de su apoyo para comprar más mercancía.
texts.en: Angélica C. is a very hardworking person. She has had her grocery store, called "Angelica," for 15 years, and in order to make more revenues is a catalog representative. Her children are already grown and have started their own families, but she is taking care of a grandson because she wants to give him better quality of life. In order to continue maintaining her store, she needs your help to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.
 
La señora Nelly es socia fundadora del banco hace ya siete ciclos con este,  está muy contenta con el Banco Comunal ya que se ha mantenido y ha crecido en el número de socias, y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Tiene 43 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos dos mayores de edad y el ultimo que tiene 16 años que estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios), también trabaja desde las 6h30 en una casa como empleada domestica pero en las tardes se dedica a recorrer con sus productos los cuales entrega ya que son bajo pedido   y cobra cada semana los domingos.

Este crédito lo quiere para pagar los pedidos que le llegan este fin de mes ya que tiene mercadería entregada y que no cobra en su totalidad.
  
Su sueño es terminar por completo su casa.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the sector known as Las Piedras, we find the Caminantes de Cristo (Followers of Christ) Communal Bank, which meets every 15 days.

Nelly is a founding member of the bank and has been with it for seven loan cycles. She is very happy with the bank because it has survived and grown its membership, and she's appreciative of Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir for the help she has received with her loans. She is 43 years old; she is married and has three children, two who are older and the other who is 16 years old and going to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.
 
She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume, and accessories). [Translator's note: Yanbal is like Mary Kay or Avon.] She also works from 6:30 am as a housemaid, but in the afternoons she travels with her products and delivers them even though she is understocked, and takes payment every Sunday.

This loan that she is requesting is to pay for the orders that are coming at the end of this month because she has already delivered some products but not gotten fully paid for them.

Her dream is to finish her house.

loans.use: Buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sandra Monserrate

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días. 

Aquí conversamos con la señora Sandra, tiene 30 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual tiene 4 hijos, dos estudian en escuela,  otro en el jardín de infantes y la última una linda pequeñita de 2 años que es la luz de sus ojos por ser la única mujer. Su esposo es chofer, realiza fletes en su carro.

Vende productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios), comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y el cuidado que tiene que brindarles a sus hijos. Trabaja todos los días por horas, aprovecha las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en  la escuela para realizar sus ventas y en las tardes se dedica a ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra cada sábado, día que aprovecha para ir a  realizar los cobros con su esposo en el carro.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar o pagar los pedidos que ha realizado. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el segundo ciclo y siempre le ha gustado por que los créditos son sucesivos, termina de pagar uno y allí está el otro rápidamente. 

Su sueño es tener un bazar con muchos productos.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the sector known as Las Piedras, we find the Caminantes de Cristo (Followers of Christ) Communal Bank, which meets every 15 days.

Here we talk to Sandra. She is 30 years old and married, and has four children through that relationship. Two of the kids are in school, one is in nursery school, and the other is a darling little 2-year-old girl who is the apple of Sandra's eye because she is the only girl. Sandra's husband is a chauffeur; he uses his own car.

Sandra sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes, and accessories). She splits her time between her work and caring for her children. She works every day for hours, enjoying the mornings when her children are in school to make sales, and spending the afternoons helping her children with their homework. She sells her products on credit and collects on them every Saturday, which is good because she can go collect payments that day with her husband in his car.

This loan will be used to buy or pay for the orders she's received. She has been with the communal bank since the second loan cycle and has always liked it because the loans are successive. She finishes paying for one, and there is the other one right away.

Her dream is to have a general store with a lot of products.

loans.use: Buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Giomara Cecilia

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.
 
La señora Giomara es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como fiscal de pago del Banco,  le encantan las reuniones ya que aprende mucho y comparte con sus amigas. Tiene 22 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene un hijo de 4 años, su marido es taxista.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios) ya lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta labor y dice que tiene muchos  clientes que le realizan sus pedidos. Trabaja de lunes a viernes  de dos a tres horas, solamente los sábados trabaja desde las 12h00 hasta las 19h00 cuando realiza los cobros de sus productos.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar sus productos y productos que estén en ofertas los cuales después que pasa la promoción los vende al precio normal y le deja buenas ganancias. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en la casa de su madre.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, in an area known as Las Piedras, one will find the Caminantes de Cristo communal bank. They have meetings every 15 days. Giomara is a founding member of the group and carries out the duties of payments auditor. She loves the meetings where she learns a lot and shares with her friends. 

Giomara is 22 years old, lives in a civil union, and has a four-year-old son. Her husband works as a taxi driver. For four years, Giomara has operated a business selling the Yanbal line of beauty products, perfumes, and accessories. She has many regular clients making orders. She works two or three hours a day from Monday through Friday. On Saturday, she works from noon to 7:00 PM collecting money for the sales.

With this loan, Giomara will buy products to sell. When she can, she buys the products on sale, to increase her earnings. Her dream is to have her own house, as she currently lives with her mother.

loans.use: Buy beauty products, perfumes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Angela Ines

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.
 
La señora Ángela esta casada y tiene tres hijos de esta relación que están estudiando  en el colegio.  Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella hace siete ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta por eso, le gusta porque los pagos son muy fáciles de cumplir y los intereses son muy bajos.

Se dedica al comercio, venden ropa por catalogo, productos de Avon  (productos de belleza,  perfumería y accesorios), trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 17h00, deja a crédito y cobra todos los fines de semana, realiza los pedidos cada fin de mes, los pedidos de ropa los recibe en el centro en Portoviejo en una distribuidora.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de su mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos y no tiene capital propio para cancelar.
 
Su sueño es  tener su propia distribuidora.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, in a neighborhood known as "Las Piedras," we find the communal bank "Caminantes de Cristo," which meets every 15 days.

Angela is married, and she and her husband have 3 children who are studying in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has been a member of this communal bank for 7 loan cycles, and she is very pleased to be a member; she likes it because the payments are very easy to make and the interest charged is very low.

Angela works in retail trade, selling clothing and Avon products (beauty products, perfumes and accessories) through a catalog.  She works every day from 2pm until 5pm.  She extends credit to her customers and makes her collections during the weekends.  She takes orders at the end of every month, and she receives those orders from a distributor in central Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, since she has a number of orders and she does not have enough capital of her own to complete them.

Her dream is to have her own distribution business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, beauty products, perfumes and accessories

loans.name: Las Nazarenas Group

texts.es: La señora yeng tiene 42 años y vive en Huaycan, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ademas es la presidenta del grupo "Las Nazarenas" que se conforma por 8 amigas las cuales se conocieron el el colegio "El Nazareno", pues sus hijos estudian ahi. Este es un nuevo grupo y esperan el apoyo de Edaprospo para mejorar su calidad de vida y desarrollar sus negocios, por su parte la señora Yeng vende comida entre las calles Misti y Huascaran, lleva 10 años en este rubro y vende aproximadamente 30 platos por dia el cual le ayuda para mantener su hogar, arreglar su casa e implementar su bodega con muchos mas productos hasta convertirla en un Minimarket, pero para eso necesita trabajar duro y tambien de las habilitaciones por parte de Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Ms. Yeng is 42-years-old and lives in Huaycan. She's single and has 2 children. She's the president of the group "Las Nazarenas," which consists of 8 friends who met each other in the "El Nazareno" school, where their children now study. This is a new group and they're counting on the support of EDAPROSPO to improve their quality of life and develop their businesses. 

Ms. Yeng sells food between the streets Misti and Huascaran. She's worked this area for 10 years and she sells approximately 30 plates per day, which helps her maintain her home, fix her house and stock her store with many more products until it becomes a Minimarket. But for this she needs to work hard with the help of EDAPROSPO.

loans.use: Purchase of products and consumables

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita C. is from the village of Centro Napo Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing beauty parlor services such as haircuts, manicures and pedicures in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Conchita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Conchita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to to expand services provided.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice A. is from the city of Kinuman Norte Ozamiz City. She is 27 years old, married, and has one infant child. To make a living, Janice owns and operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Janice has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Janice is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Janice from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn A. is from the city of Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Merlyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora A. is from the village of Solinog Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Aurora is widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Aurora owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste,  salt, sugar, soft drinks, and fruits in the local community. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aurora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aurora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dina Cris

texts.en:
Dina Cris A. is from the village of Macabibo Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ.. She is 31 years old and married. To make a living, Dina Cris owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, dried fish, biscuits, and noodles in the local community. Dina Cris has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP.

In 2010, Dina Cris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dina Cris is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dina Cris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yolinda's Group

texts.en: Yolinda K. is from the village of Macabibo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Yolinda is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Magnolla. Yolinda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Yolinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as sugar, rice, snack food, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Yolinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Yolinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La señora Ela tiene 50 años y vive en la zona G D. huaycan, es separada y tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales aun tiene a uno a su cargo y es la presidenta del grupo "Trabajando para el Futuro" el cual se conforma D. 7 vecinas y amigas unidas por sus ganas D. mejorar. El grupo lleva un año trabajando con Edaprospo y esperan llegar a sus metas gracias a su apoyo. La señora Ela ha vendido pollo, cerveza, gaseosas y bebidas en general por 20 años y lo sigue haciendo para ayudar asu hija Fabiola ensus estudios D. colegio particular. Pienza poner su propia polleria ahorrando el dinero q le envia su esposo desD. la selva, su trabajo y el capital que espera por parte D. Edaprospo que le ayudara a conseguir sus metas aunque para esto necesite mas habilitaciones.
texts.en:
Ela is 50-years-old and lives in Zone G of Huaycan. She's separated and has 7 children, one of whom still lives with her. She's the president of the group "Trabajando para el Futuro" ("Working for the Future"), which consists of 7 neighbors and friends united by their desire to improve their lives. The group has been working with EDAPROSPO for a year and they hope to reach their goals thanks to its support. 

Ela has sold chicken, beer, sodas, and other drinks for 20 years and she continues to do so in order to help her daughter Fabiola in her studies at a private school. She hopes to open her own poultry store with the money she's saving that her husband sends from the jungle. She hopes that her job and the working capital from EDAPROSPO will help her achieve her goals, even though she'll probably still need a little more assistance.

loans.use: Purchase of products and consumables

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: La señora Nely tiene 39 años y vive en la zona Q D. Huaycan, es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales aun tiene a cargo a 2 y es la presidenta del Grupo "Mujeres del Sol". El grupo ha trabajado con Edaprospo por 2 años y esta conformado por 10 amigas - vecinas. La señora Nely ah vendido objetos electrodomesticos D. segunda por 18 años y lo sigue haciendo para sustentar su hogar y los estudios D. sus hijos, el ultimo prestamo lo utilizara para aumentar la mercaderia D. sus negocio y esperacon la ayuda D. Edaprospo poner su propio taller textil, aunque para esto necesite mas habilitaciones y mas esfuerzo D. su parte.
texts.en: Nely is 39-years-old and she lives in Zone Q of Huaycan. She lives with a common law husband and has 6 children, 2 of whom still live with her. She's the president of the group "Mujeres del Sol" ("Women of the Sun"). The group has worked with EDAPROSPO for 2 years and consists of 10 friends/neighbors. Nely has sold second-hand home electronic devices for 18 years and continues to do so to maintain her home and her children's studies. She used the last loan to increase her merchandise and she hopes that with the help of EDAPROSPO she'll be able to open her own textile workshop, though she's aware that it will take more help and hard work on her part.

loans.use: Purchase of products and consumables

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 26 years old and single. She runs Hollywood stores in a very competitive environment. She also supplies milk so as to earn extra income. She has been operating the business for one and a half years.  

She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has requested 13,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice, beans and maize for resale. She sees herself becoming a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and maize for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 51-year-old married man with three children. He is a member of the Masaa group in Faulu Kenya.  

To earn a living, he does welding. He has been running the business for 28 years and he has managed to employ five people. In addition to welding, he is also a farmer who rears chickens.  

He is glad that Faulu Kenya has been financially supportive to him in his business. This has helped him to buy materials and machines for welding. 

He has requested 90,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metals and a drilling machine.  He hopes to have his own metal-fabrication industry in the future.

loans.use: To buy metals and a drilling machine

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 36 years old and a mother of two.  She runs Joy Medical Clinic to earn a living.  The business is located in a very competitive and crowded area with most of her customers being low-income earners.  She was previously employed before she went into her own business.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy syrups.  She hopes to own rental houses in the future.  In five years, she wants to own the business premises instead of renting them.

loans.use: To buy syrups

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 29 years old, married, and has a four-year-old child.  For eight years, she has been running Rocky Hair salon.  She opened the salon after closing her barber shop.  She also runs a butcher shop.  She is glad that Faulu Kenya has helped her to start her beauty salon, which is now running well.  She hopes to improve her salon business and move the business to the city center.  She has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy beauty products, a steamer, and a flat iron.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, a steamer, and a flat iron

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 26 years old and a member of Jiinuwe Ngando group.  He runs a beauty shop and a mobile-phone money transfer business.  He has been running the business for three years and employs one person.  Faulu Kenya has helped him to manage his business and he has become more focused.  He has requested for 20,000 KES to buy weaves and braids for his beauty shop and float for his mobile-phone money transfer business. He hopes to be the major supplier of beauty products in his locality.

loans.use: To buy weaves and braids for his beauty shop and float for his mobile-phone money transfer business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy W. M. is 34 years old and single. She is a hardworking business lady and a seamstress. She also sells ready-made clothes. She has been in business for five years.

Mercy has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has learned how to keep business records and has better customer care skills. With the loan of 20,000 KES she will buy fabric for making more clothes. She hopes to open another outlet for her business in the future and employ people.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface W. K. is 43 years old and a married man with two children. He is a welder. He sells mainly doors and windows to the people in his area. He has been in business for four years. He also farms to supplement his family’s income.

Boniface is a registered member of Faulu Kenya, and it has motivated him in his business. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy welding materials. He hopes to stabilize his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy welding materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is married to Ceasar B., who is 41 years old and a farmer. They have six children ranging in age from 2 months to 7 years old. The family lives in Sitio-Lawis within the barangay of Mainggit, a part of Toledo City on Cebu island. Evangeline earns her living by selling vegetables.

Evangeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,000 PHP, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her fifth loan cycle, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Evangeline B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L. is married to Manolito L., Jr., who is fifty years old and works as an operator to earn his living. They have six children who range in age from 14 to 28 years old. Two of their children have their own families, one is employed, two are looking for jobs and the youngest is currently going to school. The family lives in the barangay of Talavera, a part of Toledo City on Cebu island. Maria runs two businesses: a sari-sari (general) store and a ready-to-wear clothing shop.

Maria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her sixth loan cycle, she is borrowing 16,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and help her youngest finish school. Maria L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana I. is a 57-year old married woman who supports her family by baking cakes. She lives in South Bag in the barangay of Mangnao, a part of Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental province on the western Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her cake baking business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 59,800 PHP from her baking business.

Ana is borrowing 49,000 PHP so that she can buy baking supplies wholesale. This will be her tenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase baking supplies wholesale

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros A. is a 51-year old married woman who supports her family by running three business ventures: a jewelry store, a peddling shop and a general store. She lives in San Gregorio within the barangay of Paglaum, Binalbagan municipality, a part of Negros Occidental province on the Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her jewelry store, peddling shop and general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 35,000 PHP.

Milagros is borrowing 30,000 PHP so that she can purchase a transport vehicle to use in her businesses. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Milagros aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.name: Janet Awuor

texts.en:
Janet Awuor O. is 37 years old and married to Francis Mweu, a businessman who contributes to the family’s income. They have two children ages sixteen and thirteen years. They live in the rift-west area of Kitale, Kenya. Janet has been operating a general store for twelve years and earns a monthly profit of 30,000 KES.

Janet learned about KADET through a credit officer. She is applying for a second loan of 20,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to buy 100 liters of cooking oil, two bags of sugar and five bundles of baking flour. With the anticipated profits from her loan, she plans to build a rental house and secure a steady income flow.

In the future Janet wishes to live a better and more comfortable life.

Dioscora is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase ingredients for her food sales business. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dioscora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion M. is a married woman who lives in Sitio-Nino, DAS, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: pig Fattening, livestock and sari-sari (general) store businesses. Her husband Arneto M. Sr., who is 36 years old, buys and sells livestock to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are 1 to 13 years old.

Visitacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Visitacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped increase her monthly income to PHP 48,000, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her various business activities so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements. Visitacion M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Ining, Brgy. San Pablo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: General Store and Tricycle transport businesses. Her husband Carlito, who is 52 years old, works as a Tricycle Driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are 20 to 27 years old.

Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Helen E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina C. is a 35-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and an electronic re-loading business. She lives in Caragay, Brgy. Gun-ob, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. Josefina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and her electronic re-loading business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 28,000 PHP. 

Josefina is borrowing 25,000 PHP so she can purchase more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Josefina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia O. is a widow who lives in Prk. Trece, Brgy. Tiniguiban, Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: she runs a restaurant, rents out commercial space and is an authorized purified water distributor. She has three adult children. Cornelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired to something better for her family. 

With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cornelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her raise her family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to expand and improve her restaurant so that she can continue to save up in order to buy a motorcycle for business use. Cornelia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.
