loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur saliou G. est âgé de 40 ans il est commerçant de produits alimentaires tels que le riz, l'huile et autres produits divers à Thiadiaye .Sa boutique constitue son gagne pain pour cela il vient solliciter ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités .Également le sieur G. espère avec ce crédit disposer plus de revenus pour subvenir à ses dépenses quotidiennes et à l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en: Mr. Saliou G. is 40 years old and sells food products such as rice, oil and various other products in Thiadiaye. His shop is his livelihood and for this reason he is requesting this loan in order to strengthen his business. Mr. G. is also hoping to increase his disposable income in order to provide for his daily expenses and his children's education.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo B. G.  oriundo de sabanalarga, lugar donde se dice que “La Inteligencia es peste” tiene un puesto de frutas donde también ofrece servicio de llamadas, y vende lotería, ubicado  en un lugar público muy cercano a una terminal de transportes y le va muy bien, porque permanentemente salen y llegan buses interdepartamentales y sus pasajeros compran las deliciosas frutas para emprender su viaje, hacen llamadas mediante cualquier operador y también compran su boleto de lotería o chance soñando con ser algún día millonarios o tener unos pocos pesos mas para pasar un momento feliz.   

Su vida ha cambiado mucho, y dice que ha dado un giro de 360 grados  desde que se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y obtuvo su primer crédito, pues con ninguna otra institución lo había logrado. Su credikiva es su quinto crédito, porque quiere comprar frutas al por mayor debido a que próximamente distribuirá a otros comerciantes y también realizará una adecuación locativa en su cocina.

Gumercindo es un hombre muy trabajador y ejemplar padre de familia,  que inició el negocio que su papá le enseñó cuando se dedicaba a vender lotería desde sus 17 años y durante algún tiempo esta fue su actividad principal y fuente de ingresos; tiempo después se desempeñó como voceador de prensa y tenia ayudantes que no le respondían con el dinero que él debía pagar  a la empresa, que se lo acreditaba diariamente. Sin embargo esto no le quitó el entusiasmo de continuar trabajando dedicado al negocio,  a través de el  logró educar en el colegio a sus hijos y hoy algunos están trabajando en empresas de la ciudad y otros siguen los consejos de su padre en la actividad comercial. Como ha sido un gran ahorrador compró con sus utilidades su lote y construyó su casa en el barrio Carrizal, gracias al sacrificio y fuerza de voluntad para sacar adelante a su familia y por eso hoy se siente feliz y continúa trabajando para fortalecer mas, sus ingreso y continuar mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gunmercindo B. Gomez is a native of Sabanalarga, a place where they say "intelligence is endemic."  He has a fruit stand where he also offers calling services and sells lottery tickets.  It is located in a public place very close to a bus terminal, and the business is going very well because there are constantly people who are traveling and inter-departmental (long-distance) buses that are arriving.  Their passengers buy the delicious fruit to start their trip with and make calls through an operator, and they also buy lottery tickets, dreaming that some day they will become millionaires or have a few more pesos that they can enjoy.

His life has changed a lot, and he says that it changed 360 degrees since he became involved with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and got his first loan, which he was not able to do with any other institution.  This Kiva loan is his 5th loan; he wants to buy fruit at wholesale which he will turn around and distribute to other traders, and he also wants to make some improvements to his kitchen.

Gumercindo is a hardworking man and an exemplary father.  He began in the business that his father taught him; he was selling lottery tickets from the time he was 17 years old.  For some time this was his main activity and source of income.  Sometime later he worked selling newspapers.  He had assistants who did not bring back the money that he had to pay the company, which he had to deposit daily.  But this did not cause him to lose his enthusiasm to continue working and dedicate himself to his business.  Through the business he managed to educate his children and today some of them are working in companies in the city and others work in commercial activities with the advice of their father.  As he has been a good saver, he bought a lot with his earnings and built his house in the Carrizal neighborhood, thanks to his sacrifice and his will to get ahead with his family.  For this reason, he now feels content and will continue to work to further improve his income and his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale to distribute to other traders and also to make improvements to his kitchen

loans.name: Ivan Enrique

texts.es:
“La Súper Arepa” es el negocio que  Iván Álvarez, de 26 años, inició desde hace un poco más de cinco años,  para resolver los ingresos de su familia cuando contrajo matrimonio y debía asumir su nueva responsabilidad. Así fue como inició con su carrito de madera y gradualmente ha ido agregándole las sillas, fogones, ollas y un molino al que èl mismo adaptò un motor; porque sus arepas son muy naturales y están fabricadas con el más puro y fresco maíz. En la actualidad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 7 años de edad en el barrio Las Nieves de Barranquilla, ubicado al sur de esta ciudad, que tiene muchas características típicas de la cultura caribe arraigadas, como la música y las fiestas por cualquier actividad y su cultura es un aporte a la conservación de las tradiciones populares, lo cual favorece el mercado permanente de Iván Enrique.
Su credikiva  es el primer financiamiento de Iván y como sueña con empezar a ampliarlo y diversificarlo, lo invertirá en la compra de su materia prima al por mayor  y adecuar su carro en el que vende el producto;  más adelante piensa crear varias unidades de negocios, ubicadas estratégicamente pensando en aumentar sus ingresos,  para ofrecerle un futuro promisorio a su familia especialmente a su hijo y constituir un capital que en el futuro convierta esta actividad en una gran empresa familiar.
texts.en:
Iván Álvarez, twenty-six, started his business, "The Super Arepa," a little more than five years ago to secure his family's income when he got engaged and had to assume his new responsibility.  He started out with a wooden cart and has gradually added chairs, a burner, pots and a grinder, which he retrofitted with a motor because his arepas are very natural, made with the purest and freshest corn.  

He currently lives with his partner and seven-year-old son in the Las Nieves de Barranquilla neighborhood, south of the city.  It has many of the typical Caribbean cultural characteristics, like the music and fiestas, which help conserve the popular traditions that favor Iván Enrique's permanent market. 

This is Iván's first Kiva loan.  Because he dreams of beginning to expand and diversify his business, he plans to invest in some wholesale supplies and fix up the car he uses to sell his product.  Later he's thinking about starting up several branches, strategically located to increase his income so he can offer his family, and especially his son, a promising future, and turn his business into a large family enterprise.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies and fix up the car he uses to sell his product.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena Rodríguez M. es una joven comerciante de 24 años de edad, casada, madre de un niño de cinco años y junto a él y su esposo reside en la Colonia Los Ángeles en la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. De Lunes a Viernes María Elena tiene un empleo fijo y desde hace un año en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta ambulante de joyería de plata y otros productos de uso personal. Ella es una persona con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo y estudio. María Elena solicita el financiamiento para comprar una mayor cantidad de joyas como aritos, pulseras, cadenas, anillos, etc. para así llamar la atención de sus clientas con estilos nuevos y a la moda. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera obtener más ganancias para seguir pagando sus estudios universitarios y los de su pequeño hijo. Su sueño es graduarse lo más pronto posible para dejar de su empleo y establecer su propio negocio a tiempo completo. Tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y ser cliente de la institución le ha ayudado a mejor su vida económica.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a young merchant, 24 years of age, married, mother of a 5-year-old boy.  Together with him and her husband, she resides in Colonia Los Angeles, in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho province.  From Monday through Friday she has fixed employment, and for the last year, during her free time, she sells jewelry, silver, and other personal-use products in the streets. Maria Elena is a person with very good references from her neighbors, fellow workers, and classmates.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of jewelry, such as earrings, bracelets, chains, rings, etc., to attract the attention of her customers with new and fashionable styles. With the help of the loan, she hopes to obtain more earnings in order to continue paying for her university studies and her little child's expenses.

Her dream is to graduate as soon as possible, so she can leave her job and establish her own full-time business.  She has had various loan cycles with FAMA and while a client of this institution, she has been able to better her life economically.

loans.use: BUYING JEWELRY AND OTHER PERSONAL-USE PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Josué Abinadab

texts.es:
Josué es un agricultor, tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, residen en Concepción Batres en el Departamento de Usulután, él se dedica desde muy pequeño al trabajo de la tierra por que su padre siempre se dedico a este oficio, para Josué no es dificultad el trabajar sembrando pues lo desempeña muy bien, sus cultivos son el Maíz y Pipián además cuando hay muchos gastos en su familia el también construye casas y realiza viajes en su camión siempre viendo la forma de salir adelante.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, tratamiento de plagas y semilla; este préstamo hará realidad la siembra que Josué quiere realizar pues su atraso se debe a que no cuenta con los recursos para adquirir los materiales.
Con el tratamiento adecuado desea recibir una buena producción de Maíz y Pipián que son su principal fuente de ingreso para el hogar.
Él se proyecta a futuro con más oportunidades de crecer como productor y que sus hijos tengan acceso a la educación para que mejoren sus condiciones de vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
Josué is a farmer and is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in Concepción Batres, located in the department of Usulután. He has worked in the fields since he was very young because his father worked in this trade. For Josué, farming is not difficult because he does it very well. He grows corn and pipián (a squash known as ‘cushaw’ in the United States) and when his family has a lot of expenses to pay, he also builds homes and makes trips with his truck in order to get ahead.

Josué is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides and seeds. This loan will make it possible for him to do the planting that he wants to do because he has not been able to, due to the fact that he does not have the resources to buy the materials. With the right care, he wants to have a good corn and pipián harvest because they are the household’s main source of income.

In the future, Josué plans to have more opportunities to grow as a farmer and for his children to have access to schooling so that they improve their future living conditions.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es un hombre trabajador, padre de dos hijos, pequeño comerciante desde hace varios años administra una pulpería en donde ha sido su fuentes de ingreso para alimentar a su familia.
 Anteriormente trabajaba de mecánica, pero por salud no lo hace, es donde comienza a invertir más al comercio, ya que comenzó con poco. Lo que recurre al financiamiento para poder aumentar más productos de venta para sus clientes.
Lleva tres ciclos en la institución, en donde ha invertido en la pulpería, así como en mejoras a su vivienda.
Con este préstamo quiere terminar un muro que tiene muy avanzado pero aun le falta y no ha terminado,  el cual comprara los materiales necesarios para terminar como: piedras, arena, cemento. Y contento por esta obra que solo atreves de Afodenic se ha hecho posible.
texts.en:
Esteban is the father of two children and is a hardworking man. He has been a small merchant for several years and he manages a grocery store, which has been his source of income to feed his family. He previously worked as a mechanic but no longer does so due to health reasons. This is when he began to invest more in his business since he began with little. Esteban has turned to loans to be able to have more products to sell to his customers.

He has had three loans from AFODENIC, which he has used to invest in his grocery store as well as to make housing improvements. With this loan, Esteban wants to finish a wall that is almost completed. He will buy the necessary materials to finish such as stones, sand, and cement. He said that it is only through AFODENIC that this project has been possible.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to finish building the wall that he has already started and wants to complete

loans.name: Esteban Vicente

texts.es:
Esteban es un hombre de 50 años de edad, con una hermosa familia, su esposa y dos hijos. Es un pequeño comerciante de acarreo, pues tiene su propio camión en donde día a día sale a ofrecer su servicio.
 Lleva varios años en este negocio. Lo difícil es que el combustible cada día sube de precio lo que queda poca ganancia. Su esposa lo ayuda ya que invirtió en una pulpería en donde se equilibran los gastos.
Atreves del financiamiento que es lo accesible,  quiere comprar el piso y los materiales a usar para poner en su casa ya que el que tiene esta muy quebrado y desea hacer esta mejora para poder estar en mejores condiciones. Como planes a futuro es poder seguir invirtiendo más en la pulpería siendo un ingreso seguro.
texts.en:
Esteban is a fifty-year-old man with a beautiful family, including his wife and two children.  He has a small hauling business; he has his own truck which he uses daily to offer his service.

He's been in business for a few years, and what's hard is that price of gas goes up every day, leaving him with little profit.  His wife helps him out, having invested in a grocery store which offsets their expenses.

Esteban wants to use his loan buy some flooring and the supplies to install it in his house since what he has is in very bad repair and he wants the make the improvement to have better living conditions.  His plans for the future include being able to invest more in the grocery store, which is a secure source of income.

loans.use: To buy bricks for his living room, so he can make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, casada. Se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años. Una pulpería que solo comenzó vendiendo granos básicos, con dinero que su esposo dio, dinero de su trabajo como seguridad.
Ahora cuenta con más inventario, mejores ventas, gracias a su tenacidad de empeño por ayudar a su familia. Y con el apoyo de Afodenic quien ha sido el portador de buenas nuevas a través de los financiamientos. En donde está contenta porque ha sido de mucho beneficios para el bienestar económico.
Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de más productos como: cuatro quintales de arroz, dos quintales de azúcar veinte cajas de gaseosas, golosinas, pollo  productos lácteos. Logrando más la inversión en su negocio ya que la demanda es mucho.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working woman.  She is the mother of two children and she is married.  She has dedicated herself to her business for several years.  It is a small grocery store that began selling basic grains with money that her husband gave her, money from his work in security.  Now it has more inventory and better sales thanks to her tenacious effort to help her family.  With the support of Afodenic, who has been the bearer of good news with regards to financing, she is happy because her economic well-being has greatly improved.  
With this loan she will invest in the more products like: 400 lbs of rice, 200 lbs of sugar, 4 boxes of sodas, candy, chicken, dairy products.  She will invest more in her business because now there is a lot of demand.

loans.use:
Invertira en la compra de granos basicos, golosinas, productos lacteos, pollo entre otros para fortalecer el negocio
For investing in the purchase of basic grains, candies, dairy products, and chicken - among other things - to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy building materials and supplies to build a new interior wall to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.name: Grace Nana Mensiwa

texts.en: Grace Nana Mensiwa D. sells different kinds of soap and tomatoes at Elmina. Grace has received junior high education. She is married to a farmer. She helps her husband in taking care of the household.  Her loan will be used to buy more soap to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the acquisition of a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more soap to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is divorced and takes care of two children. She has no educational background. Ama processes palm kernel oil for sale at Elmina. She has been in this business for twenty years. Ama uses the income she makes to insure the family’s well-being. Ama will use the loan to purchase more palmnuts to prepare palm kernel oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more palmnuts to prepare palm kernel oil for sale

loans.name: Mary Nana Ama

texts.en: Mary Nana Ama W. B. sells smoked fish and 'gari' (manioc grits) at Elmina. Mary has not received any formal education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She responsibly helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her dependents' education.

loans.use: buy extra fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Rebecca Aba Amosiwa

texts.en: Rebecca Aba Amosiwa M. sells 'gari' at Elmina. Rebecca has no educational background. She is divorced and has five dependents. She has been in this trade for six years now. She sees to the well-being of her family with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more 'gari' to sell. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more 'gari' (manioc grits) to sell

loans.name: Hagar Nana Adjoa

texts.en: Hagar Nana Adjoa M. smokes fish to sell at Elmina. Hagar has been through junior high level of education. She is married to a farmer and together they live with their four children. She helps her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy additional fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: buy additional fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is divorced and has four children. She has attained senior high level of education. Esi sells children's wear at Elmina by moving from one area to another. Esi uses her income to pay for accommodation and utility bills.  Esi will use the loan to purchase more children's wear to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase more children's wear to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Adjoa Bedu

texts.en: Elizabeth Adjoa Bedu M. sells 'wakye' with sauces at Elmina. She serves it with tomatoes and black sauce. Bedu is divorced and takes care of seven dependents. She has junior high educational background. Elizabeth responsibly takes care of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans to prepare 'wakye' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bedu plans to invest into her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase more rice and beans to prepare 'wakye' (rice and beans cooked together) for sale

loans.name: Efua Aye Theresa

texts.en: Efua Aye Theresa T. sells "bodoo" (a local dish made from corn) and pineapple at Elmina. T. has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman. T. has been in this business for two years. She responsibly supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare "bodoo" for distribution and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business in helping her husband take care of her children.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare "bodoo" for distribution

loans.name: Cecelia Efua

texts.en: Cecelia Efua Q. sells "wakye" (beans cooked with rice) by moving around in the vicinity of Elmina. Cecelia has received junior high education. She no longer lives with her husband. She takes care of four children. She makes sure her family is well taken care of with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and beans to cook "wakye" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy more rice and beans to cook "wakye" for sale

loans.name: Araba Eshun Florence

texts.en: Araba Eshun Florence A. is married to a secretary and has seven dependents. She has not been to school. She sells smoked fish at Elmina. Araba helps her husband by making sure that there is always food available. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase more fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Margaret Nana

texts.en: Margaret Nana T. sells doughnuts and ice cream at Elmina.  Margaret Nana has received junior high education.  She is a widow and has four children. She responsibly takes care of her family with the income she makes. Her loan will be used to buy more ice creams for sale. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more ice creams for sale

loans.name: Magaret Efua Mansah Kakraba

texts.en: Margaret Efua Mansah Kakraba E. sells "banku" and fish at Elmina. Margaret Efua Mansah has no educational background. She is a widow and has six dependents. She responsibly takes care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to prepare "banku" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more corn to prepare "banku" (fermented corn dough) for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth Aba Yaabu

texts.en: Elizabeth Aba Yaabu Q. is married and has two children. She has no educational background. Elizabeth sells jewelry and panties at Elmina. She is able to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase additional goods to meet the demand of her customers. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase additional goods to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Mary Nana Woduawa

texts.en: Mary Nana Woduawa S. is divorced. She has received junior high education. Mary sells fruit at Elmina. She uses her income to take care of herself. Mary will use the loan to purchase more fruit for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans on ploughing back her profit back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more fruit for sale

loans.name: Mary Maame Zinabu

texts.en: Mary Maame Zinabu S. is married and has three children. She has no educational background. Mary sells porridge at Elmina. She has been in this business for six years. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mary will use the loan amount to purchase more ingredients to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to add another kind of business to her trade.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients to prepare porridge

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en: Ganna is married. She runs a small café selling meals and drinks. Ganna has been in this business for 12 years. Her net profit is 6,500 Grivnas. Ganna has many repeat customers. Her dream is to establish one more café. Ganna would like to borrow 10,000 Grivnas to increase her working capital. She hopes to receive additional income and invest the profit back into her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Celia Marianela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadi de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Celia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta, le ha gustado los créditos y la forma de trabajar de la institución.  Tiene 29 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene dos hijos, uno de apenas 35 días de nacido y otro que está  en la escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en la cual a pesar de que es pequeña tiene de todo, sus clientes son muy exigentes y siempre trata de  satisfacerles, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 18h00 dice que está a gusto con su tienda ya que le deja algunas ganancias y no tiene que salir de su casa, con esto nada le impide poder darles un buen tiempo a sus hijos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería la misma que adquiere en Portoviejo junto con su marido que le ayuda.

Su sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The members of “Nueva Ilusión” (New Illusion) communal bank meet every two weeks in Cadi, Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place renowned for its hardworking people dedicated to farming and cattle raising.

Celia, 29, is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is very happy.  She likes the loans and the way the institution operates.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children, one is only 35 days old and the other one is in school.  Her husband’s a farmer.

She has a small grocery store that, despite being small, is stocked with everything.  Her customers are very demanding and she always strives to meet their needs.  She is open for business every day from 6:30am until 6pm.  She says she is content with the store because it produces some profits and she doesn’t have to leave home.   This way nothing keeps her from spending good time with her children.

This loan is to buy more merchandise that she gets in Portoviejo with her husband who helps her.

Her dream is to have a much larger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, cheese and foodstuffs in general.

loans.name: Celia Maritza

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Celia tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, de esta relación ha tenido seis  hijos ya todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella además de una nieta que es como su hija, dos de sus hijos estudian en la Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella es comerciante, tiene una pequeña distribuidora de productos de primera necesidad, también vende artículos de bazar y papelería y en su local tiene unas cabinas telefónicas, nos cuenta que su negocio es su vida dice que empezó con una pequeña tiendita y que ahora gracias a su trabajo y dedicación a logrado crecer mucho, trabaja durante todo el día desde las 7an hasta las 18h00 que cierra su negocio, por los peligros existentes en la zona.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar una copiadora que le hace falta a su negocio, es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal es la secretaria y le gusta por las charlas informativas.
 
Su meta es tener un local mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
In the locality of Cadi, in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo---a place known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising---the members of the Nueva Ilusion (New Dream) Communal Bank gather every 15 days.

Celia is 45 years old, married, and has had 6 children, all of whom are now adults. Three still live with her, plus a granddaughter who is like another daughter. Two of her children study in the University. Her husband works in agriculture.

Celia is a merchant and has a small distributorship of products of prime necessity.  She also sells products in general and school supplies, stationary, etc.  In addition, she has some telephone boxes. 

Celia says that her store is her life.  She began with a tiny store and, now, thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has managed to grow considerably.  Celia works all day from 7:00am until 6:00pm, when she closes her business, due to the dangers present in the zone.

This loan will be used to buy a copying machine which her business lacks.  Celia is a founding member of her communal bank, and currently serves as its secretary. She especially likes the informative discussions at the bank.

Celia's  goal is to have a much larger store space.

loans.use: BUYING A COPY MACHINE FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Mercedes Maricela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución, está muy agradecida  con la Fundación Espoir por todo lo que ha hecho por ella y por sus amigas. Tiene 60 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene tres hijos mayores  ya casados, vive con su esposo y  con su madre que ya es mayorcita, su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Tiene una tiende de víveres de consumo, vende de todo aceite, arroz, detergentes, etc además de productos como carne, pescado, queso y otros productos que se venden a diario, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00, sus productos los compra en Portoviejo cada vez que le falta algo, puede ser dos veces por mes y otros productos los recibe en su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos para surtir aun más su tienda.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un mini Marquet.
texts.en:
The members of “Nueva Ilusión” (New Illusion) communal bank meet every two weeks in Cadi, Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place renowned for its hardworking people dedicated to farming and cattle raising.

Mercedes is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the benefits she gets from the institution.  She is very grateful to Fundación Espoir for everything it has done for her and her friends.

She is 60 years old, in a common law relationship and has three adult, married children.  She lives with her husband and her elderly mother.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a grocery store.  She sells everything: oil, rice, detergents, etc. and also products like: meat, fish, cheese and other items that sell daily.  She is open for business every day from 6am until 7pm.  She buys her products in Portoviejo every time she needs something.  This could be twice a month.  Some items are delivered to her store.

The loan will be used to buy more stock items for her store.

Her dream is to have a minimarket some day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, meat and groceries in general.

loans.name: Marcelo Guillermo

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

Don Marcelo tiene 30 años de edad  y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 10 años, su mujer trabaja en el hospital de Solca, tiene un hijo de 8 años que estudia en la escuela.

El se dedica a la venta de ropa, también a la  agricultura, siembra cultivos de ciclo corto como el maíz y pepinos los mismos que cuando los cosecha los lleva al mercado y los vende a comerciantes, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7am hasta las 13h00,  en las tardes ofrece sus productos de ropa por catalogo, la cual deja a crédito y cobra los sábados y domingos. Los pedidos los hace cada quince días y recibe los productos en Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar la mitad para comprar ropa y la otra parte para comprar insumos agrícolas. Es el segundo ciclo que está en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. 

Su meta es poner un local de ropa.
texts.en:
The district of Cadi, Colon in the city of Portoviejo is a well known for its dedicated and hardworking population made up of mostly agriculturists and farmers. The members of the community bank Nueva Ilusion meets every two weeks. 

Marcelo is 30 years old and he has lived with his girlfriend for the past 10 years. She works in the Solca hospital. They have an 8 year old son together and he is attending school. 

He sells clothing but he is also an agriculturist. He cultivates short cycle produce such as corn and cucumbers. He takes his harvest to the market and he sells to the merchants. He works from Monday to Friday from 7am until 1pm. In the afternoons he sells his clothing merchandise through a catalogue. He completes his sales in credit and he collects payments on Saturdays and Sundays.  He takes orders every two weeks and he receives the products from Portoviejo. 

A portion of this loan will be used to purchase clothing merchandise and the remaining part will be invest in the purchase of agricultural products. This is his second loan cycle with the community bank and he has greatly enjoyed it for the ease of accessing a loan. 

His goal is to have a clothing store.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and agricultural products.

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Ana tiene 46 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la que tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad pero  aún viven con ella y estudian en Universidad, sus hijos menores  estudian en el colegio. Su marido es taxista.

Es una ama de casa que al ver que a su marido no le alcanza para los gastos familiares ha decidido poner una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, ha adecuado las perchas las cuales las mando a hacer de madera y solo le falta surtirla de los productos de primera necesidad, tiene sus ahorros  que los va a invertir en esto pero no le alcanza, es para esto que solicito el crédito, para comprar lo necesario para surtir su tienda.

Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le ha gustado las charlas.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña y que su tienda tenga el éxito.
texts.en:
The district of Cadi, Colon in the city of Portoviejo is a well known for its dedicated and hardworking population made up of mostly agriculturists and farmers. The members of the community bank Nueva Ilusion meets every two weeks.

Ana is 46 years old and she lives with her boyfriend. Together they have 5 children, two of them are grown but they still live with her and are attending university. Her youngest children are in school. Her partner is a taxi driver. 

She is a stay at home Mom but she noted that her husband does not make enough money to cover the family's expenses. She decided to set up a small grocery store in her home.  She has had display cases made up of wood and the only thing she's missing is to stock the store with basic needs items. She has some savings that she will use to this end but it will not be enough for her goal. For this reason she requests a loan, to purchase the necessary merchandise to stock the store. 

She has been a member of this community bank for the past three loan cycles and she has greatly enjoyed the information sessions.

Her dream is to have her home in a good state of repair. Her home is made of sugar canes and he dreams of having a successful store.

loans.use: To purchase basic grocery store items.

loans.name: Modesta Felicidad

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora  Modesta, ella tiene 57 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad que aun viven con ella, el esposo es agricultor. Hace muchos años ella aprendió corte y confección en una Academia Artesanal en el Cadi.

Es así como tiempo después decidió poner su taller de costura, primero empezó con una máquina de coser y ahora ya cuenta con tres maquinas ya que una de sus hijas también aprendió esta profesión y cose junto a ella, confeccionan todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más le agrada es hacer ropa de mujer ya que siempre le traen nuevos modelos que quieren sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 20h00 que se va a descansar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas y materiales para la costura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran taller de costura en el Portoviejo.
texts.en:
Cadí is part of the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo; a place known for its hard working people, dedicated to farming and raising livestock.  Here is where the members of the “Nueva Ilusión” (New Illusion) communal bank meet.

Modesta is 57 years old, married, and has three adult children who still live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.  Many years ago she learned how to make clothing in an artisan academy in Cadí.

She later decided to start her sewing shop.  She started with a single sewing machine and now she has three.  One of her daughters has also learned this trade and sews alongside her.  They make all sorts of clothing, but what she likes the most is making women’s clothing because her customers constantly bring her new fashions that they want.  She works every day from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies.  She’s been part of the communal bank from its inception and enjoys it because the interest rates are low.  She dreams of having a large sewing shop in Portoviejo.

loans.use: Sewing supplies

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
José Juan tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Ferreñafe y ubicada a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de carne de pollo en los diversos caseríos de la zona, para lo cual se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina que sirve para transportar carga y pasajeros) el recorre la zona ofreciendo su mercadería y cuando ya terminó de vender su productos se encarga de brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros.

José desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de pollos para la posterior comercialización de su carne.

José es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador. Los ingresos que percibe los suele utilizar para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía.
texts.en:
José Juan is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Pítipo district, an agricultural zone located in the Ferreñafe province, and 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He’s been selling poultry in the various hamlets in the zone [where he lives] for the past year.  He travels all around the zone in his mototaxi (a motorcycle modified to include a passenger compartment), offering his merchandise.  When he is sold out, he offers transportation services for passengers and cargo.

José wants to acquire more merchandise in order to expand his business, so he’s seen fit to request his first loan of 800 PEN ($300) through Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the money from this loan to buy chickens so that he can sell more poultry.

José is a responsible hard working young man.  He uses his income to pay his personal expenses and to offer some financial support to his family.

loans.use: Expand his poultry business

loans.name: Cinthia Vanessa

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Cinthia, tiene 26 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos uno de 7 años y otro de seis meses, el primero estudia en escuela. Su esposo tiene un local de accesorios para carro.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende  artículos para el hogar como por ejemplo planchas, licuadoras, camas, colchones, etc. Ella sale a recorrer con una revista donde están todos sus productos, los ofrece y si los clientes le compran al otro día les lleva los pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana o cada quince días. Estos productos ella los recibe en Portoviejo en una distribuidora que le entrega a un precio razonable para que a ella le quede ganancias.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en pagar ciertos pedidos que tiene para estos días, ya que todo su capital esta invertido y tiene que cumplir con los pedidos. Esta en el Banco desde el comienzo y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilusión communal bank meets every 15 days in the Cadí area of the Colón parish, located in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people and its business in farming and cattle farming.

Here we find Cinthia, who is 26 years old and has a common-law husband. They have two children – one is 7 years old and is in school, and the other is 6 months old. Cinthia’s husband has a business selling car accessories.

Cinthia works selling household items such as irons, blenders, beds, mattresses, etc. She goes out with a magazine that shows her products to sell. If the customers buy them, she brings their orders another day, leaves them on credit, and picks up the payments on the weekends or every 15 days. She gets the items at a distributor in Portoviejo who sells them to her at a reasonable price so that she can make money from it.

Cinthia will use this loan to pay for some of the recent orders because all of her capital is invested and she needs to fill the orders. She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she likes the way that the institution works.

Her dream is for her business to continue growing.

loans.use: To pay for the orders of various items.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de San José. Una zona pesquera que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a  veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la preparación y venta al por mayor de papas rellenas y tortas de choclo (platos típicos de la zona usados generalmente como aperitivos). Ella prepara estos productos en su vivienda y luego los distribuye en los restaurantes y puestos de venta de comida en su localidad. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Su esposo es pescador y con los ingresos que ambos perciben se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Carmen Rosa desea adquirir mas insumos para ampliar su producción y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Asimismo desea adquirir mas cerveza para ampliar su negocio de venta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Carmen es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a mother to her family and is 31-years-old.  She lives with her husband in the San Jose district. They live in a fishing area in the Lambayeque province that is located 20 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo.

She has worked for six years preparing and selling wholesale papas rellenas [stuffed potatoes] and tortas de choclo [a sweet corn cake] which are typical dishes in this area that are generally served as appetizers.  She prepares these products in her home and then distributes them to restaurants and food stands in her area.  Additionally, she works selling beer out of her home.  Her husband is a fisherman and with both of their incomes they are able to support their family.

Carmen Rosa would like to purchase more supplies to expand her production and increase her profits. She would also like to acquire more beer to expand her sales business.  In order to achieve her goal, she has found it convenient to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 soles.

Carmen is a very responsible woman and very devoted to her family.  Her greatest desire is to see her family make progress and enjoy a greater quality of life.  Everyone who knows her considers her to be someone who is very friendly and who can be counted on.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to expand her business producing and selling appetizers.

loans.name: Domitila Filadelfia

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Domitila tiene 64 años y esta casada hace muchos años,  de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos aunque uno de ellos falleció, nos cuenta con tristeza que el dolor más grande que tuvo fue perder a su hijo. Su esposo es agricultor.

Es un ama de casa que se da tiempo para dedicarse a la compra y venta de leche, además tiene una pequeña granja de pollos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am que recibe la leche cerca de su casa, mas tarde  se dedica  junto con su esposo a entregarla por todo el sector, en cuanto a los pollos los tiene por espacio de dos meses luego los pela y los entrega en tiendas o los vende por libras a personas de la localidad.

Ella es fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta porque las cuotas son fáciles de cumplir siempre y cuando se trabaje con responsabilidad. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos para la cría y para pagar la leche que es un pago semanal.
 
Su sueño es tener una granja grande de pollos para vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ilusion” (New Illusion) communal bank meets every two weeks in Cadí, Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo, a place renowned for its hard working people who are farmers and cattlemen.

Domitila, 64, has been married for many years.  She had five children but one died.  She tells us with much sadness that losing her child was the greatest pain she’s ever experienced.  Her husband’s a farmer.

She is a housewife but uses some of her time to be a milk merchant.  She also has a small chicken farm.  She works daily from 6am to receive the milk that’s delivered to her house.  Later she and her husband distribute it throughout the sector.  As for the chickens, she keeps them for a period of time of two months and then she plucks them and sells them to local stores or by the pound to local residents.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the installments are easy to pay as long as one works with responsibility. 

She will use this loan to buy chickens to raise and to pay for the milk which is a weekly expense.

Her dream is to have a large chicken farm in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To pay for the milk and to buy chickens.

loans.name: Fermin Geremias

texts.es:
Fermín es un padre de familia que tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos a cargo de 10, 14 y 18 años, vive en casa propia, en el Caserío El Potrero que pertenece al distrito de Reque . La actividad principal en este sector es la agricultura y ganadería . La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas de veinteminutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la carpintería metálica y trabaja como obrero en construcción de pozos tubulares, también posee 01 mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros) con este vehículo el brinda servicio de transporte publico por las tardes. Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales de engorde. Fermín tiene mas de 07 años dedcándose a estas actividades, sus principales clientes son pobladores del caserío en el cual habita y centro de la ciudad ( Reque).

Fermín se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de construir una habitación de su vivienda.

El es una persona bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Sus clientes y conocidos le consideran alguien confiable y responsable.
texts.en:
Fermin is a father.  He is 41-years-old and has three children who are 10, 14, and 18-years-old. He lives in his own house in the village of El Potrero which is in the Reque district.  The main activity in this area is agricultural and livestock work.  The area is located a little more than 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He works in metalwork and also as a laborer in the construction of tube wells and he has a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that is a motorcycle that has an attached cabin for transporting cargo and passengers) and with this vehicle he offers public transportation services in the afternoon. His wife works raising animals for fattening. Fermin has spent more than seven years working in these activities.  His principal customers are inhabitants of the village where he lives and the center of the city of Reque.  

Fermin is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a the amount of 1000 soles that he would like to invest in purchasing construction materials to complete the construction of a room in his home.

He is a very hard-working person who is very dedicated to his family.  His customers and those who know him consider him to be a trust-worthy and responsible person.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to complete building a house.

loans.name: Irma Marlene

texts.es:
Irma tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar. Vive junto a su hermana en el distrito de Pitipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercializacion de venta de prendas de vestir para damas y niñas, asi como tambien a la venta de  calzado (en su mayoria sandalias); cuenta con aproximadamente un año de experiencia en el rubro, ella se inicio en el trabajo con ayuda de su Tia, la cual actualmente radica en la ciudad de Lima. Esta le envia ropa a precio de costo, para que ella pueda venderla en el distrito de Pitipo y en Ferreñafe.

Irma se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un prestamo de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería, ya que cuenta con varios pedidos de ropa asi como de calzado. Con esta inversión ella podrá incrementar su variedad de mercaderia, obteniendo asi mayores ingresos por ventas.

Irma esta captando mas clientes en los últimos meses, lo cual hace que su negocio esté creciendo. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales por la zona.
texts.en:
Irma, 20, is single and has no one to support.  She lives with her sister in Pítipo district, Ferreñafe province.  It is located over forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells children’s and women’s clothes as well as footwear, mostly sandals.  She has about a year’s experience in this line of work.  She started the business with help from her aunt who is now living in the city of Lima and who sends her low cost clothes that she can resell in Pítipo and in Ferreñafe.

Irma is asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She intends to use it to buy more merchandise because she has several pending orders for clothes as well as for footwear.  This investment will allow her to increase variety in her merchandise thus obtaining higher income from her sales.

In the last few months Irma has been securing more customers which cause her business to grow.  She has good personal and work references in the area.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to enlarge the business.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 48 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito pesquero D. San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace siete años al procesamiento y comercialización D. pescado seco – salado. Ella adquiere el pescado a los pescadores del lugar o se dirige al terminal pesquero D. la zona, luego lo procesa y lo deja secar para luego venderlo en los principales mercados D. la zona. El negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos para la economía D. su familia por lo que siempre trata D. brindar todo su esfuerzo para sacarlo adelante.

Juana Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más pescado fresco, D. ese modo pueD. procesar más y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Juana Rosa es una mujer bastante trabajora y empeñosa. Anteriormente ya ha trabajo con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is a 48 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the San José fishing district, a zone that is part of the Lambayeque province, located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past seven years she’s been processing and selling dried salted fish.  She either buys the fish from the fishermen in the area or heads to the zone’s fishing terminal.  She then processes and dries it so she can sell it in the zone’s principle markets.  Her business is an important source of income for her family, for which she puts forth a lot of effort to get ahead.

Juana Rosa wants to expand her business by buying more fresh fish.  In this way she can process more and increase her profits through her sales.  Because of this, she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa.

Juana Rosa is a hard working enterprising woman.  She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has proven herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: Fish for processing and resale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una madre de familia de 65 años de edad qe vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de linternas y de diversos productos ferreteros en su domicilio. El negocio ya tiene más de 10 años de antigüedad y gracias a el ha sacado adelante a su familia. El buen trato que brinda le han hecho conocida en la zona y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren comprar en su establecimiento.

Gregoria desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mercadería de modo que pueda surtir su negocio y pueda contar con stock permanente de productos. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles.

Gregoria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y luchadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir desarrollandose como empresaria y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 65 years old and a mother of her family.  She and her son live in the Lambayeque district in a commercial area located about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works selling flashlights and various hardware products out of her home.  The business is more than ten years old now and has pulled through for her family. By providing good treatment she has become known in the area and currently has a group of loyal customers who prefer to shop at her establishment. 

Gregoria wants to expand her business by purchasing merchandise so she can fill her business and can have permanent stock products. To achieve this objective she has decided to apply for a loan of 1300 soles for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa.

Gregoria is a very hardworking woman and a fighter.  Her greatest desire is to further develop as an entrepreneur and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buying items to expand business.

loans.name: Nilba

texts.es:
Nilba es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de un año de edad en el sector Colector del distrito de San José, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace seis años, ella cuenta con siete vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para venderla a una empresa acopiadora que visita el lugar y que se las compra a 0.90 céntimos el litro. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como taxista no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

Adicionalmente, Nilba siembra forraje para sus animales en una pequeña extensión de terreno cercana al área donde vive. Actualmente ella desea adquirir alimentos balanceados y algunas medicinas para mejorar su alimentación y prevenir la presencia de futuras enfermedades en sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Nilba es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de lo que hace. Ella ya ha tenido préstamos anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y también ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva, ella se encuentra muy agradecida porque siente que con esta ayuda puede seguir trabajando y sacando adelante a su negocio. En la imagen aparece junto a dos de sus vacas y a sus respectivos becerros, los cuales serán vendidos en algunos meses.
texts.en:
Nilba is 28 years old and a mother.  She lives with her husband and her 1 year old son in the Colector sector of the San José district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been farming for six years. She has seven cows which produce milk extracted and sold to a middle man company who visits this place and buys the milk at .90 cents a liter.  This business is very helpful for the support of her family, since what her husband earns as a driver is not sufficient to cover family expenses. 

In addition, Nilba plants fodder for their animals in a small plot of land near the area that they live. Currently she wants to buy feed and some medicines  to improve the animals' nutrition and prevent the occurrence of future diseases. Because of this she has decided to apply for a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Nilba is a hardworking woman who loves what she does.  She has had previous Edpyme Alternativa loans and also has had a loan funded by the Kiva Fund. She is very grateful because they feel that this support can help them continue working and advance the business.  In the picture she appears with two of their cows and calves, which will be sold in a few months.

loans.use: Expenditure on food and health of dairy cattle.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa B. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 36 years old, married and has three infant children. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the fifth loan that Luisa has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra situado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio. Su casa se encuentra situada frente al paradero de autos y mototaxis que se dirigen hacia las diversas zonas aledañas y esto le permite ofrecer sus productos a los transportistas y transeúntes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente suele vender salchipollos en su carrito sanguchero por las noches.

Yolanda desea adquirir calaminas (material para techar viviendas) para poder reforzar el techo de su vivienda, así como algunas sillas y mesas para implementar su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Yolanda es una mujer tranquila y responsable. El negocio que tiene le permite sentirse activa y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. En la zona las personas que le conoce le quieren y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old and a mother who lives with her husband in a farmhouse called Fanupe Casa Blanca in the Mórrope district, in a rural area of the  Lambayeque district. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells breakfast and lunch in a small establishment located in her home. Her house is in front of the whereabouts of cars and motorcycle taxis that go to various surrounding areas and this allows her to offer her products to carriers and bystanders who often visit the area. In addition, she also sells salchipollos in a vending cart at night. 

Yolanda wants to purchase "calaminas" (material for roofing houses) to reinforce the roof of her house and also some tables and chairs for her business. Because of this she has decided to apply for a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her to achieve her goal. 

Yolanda is a quiet and responsible woman. This business allows her to be active and help her husband with family expenses. People in the area who know her love her and think highly of her.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for expanding business selling food.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita B. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 40 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 6,000 PHP will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the fourth loan that Perlita has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Gusman

texts.es:
Gusman es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el sector Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la ganadería, el cría vacas en un corral ubicado cerca a su vivienda y comercializa la leche que produce con un acopiador de la zona. El alimenta a su ganado con alimento concentrado y pastos naturales. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el se encarga de sustentar la economía de su familia.

Gusman desea adquirir una nueva vaca para poder ampliar su negocio y percibir mas ganancias. Durante los últimos meses ha estado ahorrando dinero para lograr su objetivo y actualmente solo le hacen falta 2000 nuevos soles para conseguir su meta. Por ello ha decido solicitar por primera vez un crédito con Edpyme Alternativa.

Gusman es una persona tranquila y responsable. Durante todo este tiempo el ha vivido de la agricultura y gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Las personas que le concen le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Gusman is a 62 year old father who lives with his wife in the Santa Clara sector of the Pítipo district, an agricultural zone located in the Ferreñafe province, more than 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He’s been working in agriculture, especially livestock, since he was very young, and raises cattle in a corral located near his home.  He sells the milk to a distributor in the zone.  He feeds his cattle with concentrated feed and natural grass and supports his family financially with the income that he generates from this activity.

Gusman wants to buy a new cow so that he can expand his business and generate more income.  He’s been saving money over the past few months, so that he can achieve this goal.  He is only 2,000 PEN ($725) short of achieving his goal, so he has decided to request his first loan through Edpyme Alternativa.

Gusman is a stable and responsible person.  He’s lived off of agriculture all this time and thanks to this, has managed to get his children ahead.  People who know him consider him to be trustworthy.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina V. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Macrina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Macrina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Macrina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 5,000 PHP will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the fourth loan that Macrina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina V. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 50 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 5,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan that Marina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros A. is from the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old and a single mother of six school-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a business venture in the food sector in which she produces and sells food especially vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from ambulant vegetable vending. When afternoon comes, all her commodities are sold out. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 11,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan that Milagros has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals in every barangay (village or small district). She uses her motorcycle with sidecar to assist in selling foods. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the fifth loan that Teresita has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

Elizabeth L. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This will be the fifth loan that Elizabeth has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Carolina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal use products such as perfumes, lotions, talc powder, and make up set to the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carolina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Carolina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita S. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Perlita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals, she also sells snacks. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Perlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Jane
