loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela P. A., tiene la edad de 46 años es una madre soltera que habita con sus hijos mayores de edad en el Barrio los Meléndez, sus hijos trabajan en diferentes actividades que generan sus propios ingresos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de productos para el hogar, uso propio, abarrotes, etc. Y es para el negocio que solicita un préstamo a ser utilizado en la compra de mayor mercadería, favoreciendo a  sus ventas mensuales y permitiéndoles mejores ingresos para la mejora continua de las condiciones de vida en las que actualmente esta habitando, este no es el primer préstamo de la señora, en los año que Afodenic y fondos Kiva le han apoyado sus niveles de vida han sido mas prósperos y su familia se expresa sentirse muy contenta de los cambios positivos que han tenido en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia Estela P. A. is a 46 year-old single mother who lives with her grown children in the Los Meléndez neighborhood.  Her children work in different jobs that bring in their own income.  Julia has a small store where she sells products for the home and for personal use, groceries, etc.  She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her business, in order to stimulate her monthly sales and allow her to earn more profits so that she can improve her living conditions.

This is not her first loan.  Over the years that AFODENIC and Kiva lenders have supported her, her quality of life has become more prosperous.  Her family says they are very happy with the positive changes they have seen in their lives.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora María Auxiliadora R. A. tiene la edad de 32 años casada con dos hijos menores de edad, su esposo administra una pequeña venta de productos para el hogar, personal y abarrotes, que ayudan a solventar los gastos en los que la familia incurre mensualmente, ella así mismo apoyos a su marido en el negocio familiar, ellos batallan con una enfermedad especial que tiene su hijo menor y es por el que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que favorezcan a desarrollo y salud, con  el crédito construirán un muro en la sala de su hogar y la instalación de un puerta de madera que salvaguarde la seguridad de los suyos y la tranquilidad de los padres de beneficiar las vidas de sus pequeños, habitando en un espacio digno de morar.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora R. A. is 32 years old, married, and has two young children.  Her husband manages a small business selling home and personal products, as well as groceries in order to pay for the expenses that the family incurs on a monthly basis.  She helps her husband with the family business as well.  They are fighting a special sickness that their youngest son has and for this reason, they are requesting a loan so that they can purchase construction materials that benefit his development and health.  With the loan, they will build a wall in the living room and install a wooden door to provide security for their children and tranquility for themselves as parents of young children, giving them a decent place to live.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Chimedtsogzol

texts.en:
Chimedtsogzol D. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His oldest son is a student and his daughter attends a secondary school while his wife currently stays at home. 

Chimedtsogzol has been operating both an animal husbandry as well as agriculture business with his family's help since 1970.  He has gained a lot of experience from running his businesses. In the 30 years of operation, he has been able to provide for his family and to pay his children's tuition fees.  For the future, he hopes to expand both his businesses. He is a very hardworking man and says, "my dream is to expand my business so that we can purchase houses for my children in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia" He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en: Munhjargal D. is 22 years old and lives with his wife and infant daughter in the Arhangai providence, Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife takes care of their three-month old baby and Munhjargal works as a taxi driver. He began his business in 2007, and since then, has gained many permanent customers. His daily earnings are between 18,000 and 20,000 MNT.  For the future, he hopes to have his own taxi service center.  He says, "I try to provide fast and reliable services for my customers."  Munhjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Tsogtbayar D. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two year-old son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia.  He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. His wife works as a hairdresser in the hair salon. Tsogtbayar manages a raw material trading business in his town. He started his business in 2006 with a capital of 350,000 MNT.  After years of experience in his trade, he has established a stable operation and a good position in the business community.  Today, his working capital exceeds 1,600,000 MNT.  For the future he hopes to continue to grow his business and says, "I want to supply good quality materials in the local market".  He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui B. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His two daughters, ages 15 and 9, both attend the local school while his wife works as a nurse for the local hospital. 

Nergui started his own business in 2004 operating a grocery shop with a working capital of 1,500,000 MNT and since 2008, he has been operating a picture frame and souvenir item trading business after moving to his current town. In opening his current business, his working capital increased to 3,000,000 MNT. He used it to purchase necessary equipment for his current business.  He produces a variety of picture frames and souvenir items of good quality therefore his sales are high in the local market.  He is an honest man and says, “all I want is to have my own factory."  Nergui is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials, tools and supplies for his business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and tools

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Odgerel B. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and nine year-old daughter in an apartment in Arhangai province of Mongolia.  Her daughter attends primary school.  Odgerel makes furniture and wood items in her home.  She started this business in 2006 by purchasing necessary tools and equipment with a working capital of 350,000 MNT.  Since then, she has made quality furnishings and wood items for the people of her town.  In the 4 years of owning her business, Odgerel has not only gained experience and knowledge in making quality furniture products, but she has also gained a wide customer base. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to buy more timber and paint for her carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 29 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in Bint Jbeil.  He has been working as an electrician since 1998, with 17 years of experience.  Khodor is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time, in order to start a new additional business, to increase his income and to improve his social situation.  His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business and financial situation.  Khodor wants to start a new business, dealing with waterproof ceiling materials, etc.  Honesty and commitment are his slogans; his clients seek working with him because of his good reputation. In the future, Khodor aims to start a new business dealing with electrical construction and electrical tools.

loans.use: To start a new business selling construction materials

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz L. is from the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. She is 50 years old. Beatriz is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a business venture in the services sector offering beauty services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Beatriz has been engaged in this business for over 39 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Beatriz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Totuhan Rahimova's Group

texts.en:
Totuhan R. is the leader of the group. She is 47 years old and married.  Her spouse makes his living by working in Russia.  The couple has two sons.  The elder one helps his father, and the younger helps to keep house.  The family breeds cattle and poultry.  The business started 20 years ago when they received a cow from the couple's parents.  Business profits made it possible for them to build a house.  Totuhan hopes to get a loan in order to purchase a calf for its further fattening and resale.  For the future, she is planning to make new house repairs, to build a bath-house, to buy a car and to arrange her son’s wedding.

Iltipat E. is 42 years old and married.  Her husband works in Russia.  They have three children: the son is a private builder while both daughters are engaged in farming.  The family breeds cattle and hen.  Furthermore, in their allotment of land, corn, rice and sunflower are being cultivated. From their business profits they have managed to make house repairs and to purchase an oven.  The loan purpose is to buy a cow for its further fattening and breeding.  For the future, Iltipat is planning to build a kitchen and bath-house, to obtain a car and to arrange her children’s weddings.

Extibor A. is 28 years old and married.  She is the treasurer of the group.  Her spouse earns his livelihood by working in Russia.  The couple has two sons. She currently lives with her husband’s parents, who are farmers, brother-in-law (a cook) and sister-in-law (a seamstress).  The entire family is engaged in cattle breeding.  Their earnings made it possible for them to make house repairs.  The loan purpose is to purchase a milk cow. For the future the family is planning to finish building their house, to arrange for Extibor's son’s circumcision.  Extibor dreams of travelling to the USA. 

Maftuna A. is 20 years old and not married.  She lives together with her mother, brothers and sisters.  Both her brothers work in Russia.  The family has its own business cultivating corn and sunflower.  The family has been running this business for 16 years already.  Out of the total earnings they have managed to make house repairs and to arrange the brother’s wedding.  Maftuna’s family needs the loan in order to purchase potatoes.  In the future, Maftuna wants to get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase calves and seedlings for farming

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo F. is from the city of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City.  He is 27 years old.  Bernardo is married and has an infant child.  To make a living, Bernardo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members.  Bernardo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

Bernardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI.  Bernardo is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bernardo from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella Q. is from the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. She is 56 years old.  Estrella is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Estrella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads

loans.name: Gavharai's Group

texts.en:
Gavharai K. leads this loan group. She is 41, divorced, and has two sons, both of whom work in construction and also help their mother run a cattle-breeding business. Gavharai also has a second job working as a nurse, both hospitals and in her patient's homes. Over the last three years, the family has built a cow-shed. Now they are applying for this loan to buy a cow to fatten and breed. In the future, they hope to repair its house, install gates and pay for the wedding of its two sons. 

Saodathon K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 41, married, and is bringing up her four children by herself because her husband works in Russia. Her oldest son helps the family by working in construction while the three younger children are in school. Saodathon makes a living breeding livestock and also works as a nurse. She has applied for this loan to buy a cow to fatten and breed. In the future, she hopes to add a kitchen and a bath to her home, and buy a car. 

Manzurahon H., 21, is single and lives with her parents and brothers. Her father works in constrution, her mother is a nurse, and her brothers are employed in Russia. The family also raises livestock, grows cotton and sells dairy products. She is applying for a loan to buy a cow to fatten and breed. Her long-term goal is to have a dowry and get married.  

Dilshodbek O., 36, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. He makes a living running a mill, and has applied for this loan to buy wheat and rice for resale. In the future, Dilshodbek hopes to finish building his house and buy a car. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano S. lives in Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. He is 46 years old, married and has three school-aged children. He makes a living by running a general store where he sells food and other items people need every day. He has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from his work. He uses his income to support his family and send his children to school.

Adriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid five previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 18,000 PHP, to buy new items to sell to his customers. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve his family's living standards.  

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Suiorkan's Group

texts.en:
Suiorkan A., 57, is the group’s leader. She is married and has a son who is 24 years old and earns a living by working in construction. In 2009, the family began to supplement its income by breeding livestock. Suiorkan also raises money by reselling apples. From the money the family has earned, it has managed to have a wedding for its son and equip its kitchen. She is applying for this loan to buy an oven. In the future, she hopes to expand the family business and increase its cattle stock. 

Shailoo A., 53, is divorced. She wants to go into business raising livestock and has applied for this loan to buy five animals to raise and resell.   

Kulumkan M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 58, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband works in construction. Thirteen years ago, the family began raising livestock and is applying for this loan to buy two cows to breed. In the future, Kulumkan hopes to be able to send her two children to college.

Atyrkul O., 53, is married and has two children. Her husband makes a living as a herder. Her daughter works as a seamstress, while her son is still in school.  Atyrkul makes a living selling fruit and has applied for this loan to buy apples and pears to sell to her customers. Her goal is to have enough money to send her son to college.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to expand four small businesses

loans.name: Josphine Ndunge

texts.en:
Josphine Ndunge M. is 40 years old, single, and has four children who range in age from 25 to seven years old. They live in the town of Kitale, Kenya, where Josphine makes a living running a grocery store. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns Kshs. 15,000 per month.

Josphine is applying for her third loan, for Kshs. 50,000, to buy fruit to sell to her customers.

In the future, she hopes to own a truck and earn enough money to provide all of her children with a first-class education.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Abed is a 42 years old, married  and lives in Tyre with his beloved wife. For the last decade, he has made a living running a grocery store. He is applying for his second loan from Al Majmoua to buy items to sell to his customers. He made good use of his first loan and believes he will do well with his second because his customers are neighbors, friends and relatives. He works hard to improve his life and hopes to expand his store into a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Betina Nanjala

texts.en:
Betina Nanjala W. is a 24-year-old lady married to Levy Mugudo. They have two children, age 5 and 11 years respectively. They live in Kipsaina Kapenguria, Kenya. Betina has a grocery store where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past two years with an income of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.) per month.

Betina was introduced to KADET LTD. by a friend and she is applying for her second loan of Kshs. 40,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan, she plans to buy bananas, tomatoes, onion, carrots, pilipili hoho (peppers) and Irish potatoes. With the rest of the amount, she will renovate her new premises.

She hopes to have her own home and develop it, and also hopes for her children to have the best education.

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes, onion, carrots, pilipili hoho (peppers), Irish potatoes and renovate her new premises.

loans.name: Chynarkul's Group

texts.en: Chynarkul M. is the leader of the group. She is 44 and married. Together with her spouse, she has brought up four children. The family budget is enriched by almost all its members. The head of the family earns money by working at a building site, the son is the employee of an administration department, one of the daughters is a seamstress and the other two daughters are schoolgirls. Besides these activities, the family runs its own business of cattle breeding. Business profits have made it possible to make house repairs. Chynarkul and her family hope to get a loan in order to purchase hay for cattle feeding. In the future, she wants to arrange her son’s wedding. Mira M., 48, is married. Her profession is teaching, and by this activity, she raises 4,000 soms per month. Her family has two children. Unfortunately, four years ago, her husband lost his work and in order to support his family began to breed cattle. Over the years, the family has managed to increase their cattle stock. The loan's purpose is to purchase more cattle and to prepare hay for the winter. In the future, Mira is planning to obtain a sheepfold (an enclosure for sheep) and to increase cattle stock. Azamat T., 23, is a bachelor. Commonly, he derives an income by repairing and selling mobile phones. Three years ago, he used to work with his brother in a Central universal shop. After having been gained experience, he opened his own shop in his village. He hopes to get a loan in order to purchase mobile spare parts. In the future, Azamat is planning to open his own mobile office. Mahabat I. is the treasurer of the group. She is 29 and married. All of her children are school pupils. The family makes bread by reselling apples and pears. This business was started six years ago after selling four tons of potatoes. During these years, they have managed to build a three-room house. The family needs to get a loan in order to purchase cattle for its further resale. In the future, Mahabat, with her family, wants to buy a car. Urpeiim I., 29, is married. Together with her spouse who breeds cattle, she has raised four children. The elder sons are schoolboys. The main family business lies in cattle breeding. Three years ago, they sold a horse and out of the profits began to fatten and sell cattle. The loan's purpose is to purchase cattle and to prepare hay for cattle feeding. In the future, Urpeiim is planning to build a big new house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hay for cattle

loans.name: Alice Jumamosi

texts.en:
Alice Jumamosi Lokidiya is a hardworking lady of 37 years. She is married and together they have four children, aged nine, seven, five and two years. She has been operating a boutique shop for the past nine years and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.).

She learnt about KADET LTD and she had no history with any other MFI (microfinance institution) before. She  is applying  for her second loan of Kshs. 40,000, which she intends to use to purchase more clothes for the boutique  She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start a secondary business; that is, dairy farming.

Alice hopes to grow her business and become the leading local investor in Kapenguria, Kenya, and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes adding stock in the boutique

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Suwitri  is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Wayan Suwitri is the group treasurer of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Kertha Bakti (PK-10332).

Ni Wayan Suwitri is married and has 1 adult son. Her son now works at a hotel in Denpasar. Ni Wayan Suwitri owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily pigs. She raises the pigs for two to three months and then sells them to a buyer; the pigs are used for pig barbecue. When she sells a pig, the price is approximately 200,000 - 250,000 IDR above her initial cost for the piglet (excluding food costs). Ni Wayan Suwitri has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month from these activities. In addition to this pig breeding business, Ni Wayan Suwitri also operates a small kiosk where she sells food, snacks, and other items for daily use. She has a dream to build a larger kiosk, perhaps funded in part by the profits from her pig business.  

In 2010, Ni Wayan Suwitri joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Wayan Suwitri has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  



About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Wayan Suwitri 0 (0) merupakan 40 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Wayan Suwitri adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kertha Bakti (PK-10332).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Wayan Suwitri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 20 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Suwitri menghasilkan sekitar 0,100 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Wayan Suwitri bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Wayan Suwitri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 62 year old man living in Tyre with his wife.  He has worked in selling electrical appliances and sanitary wares since 2007. This is the first time Jihad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, and it is for increasing his stock in order to increase his income and support his business.

Jihad believes that this loan will improve his living situation and help his family. His good reputation helped a lot in increasing his clients since most of them are relatives, neighbors, friends, and friends of friends. He has experience in this field and hopes to improve and expand his field of work as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic S. is from the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. She is 35 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en:
Chinzorig P. is a 29 year old single parent who lives with her mother, brother and son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son, age 10, attends a local secondary school while her mother is retired and stays at home.

Chinzorig operates a transport service in her town. She uses her own Russian jeep to transport people between neighboring towns. She started her transportation business in 2010 after operating a small cafe in a rented space since 2001. Also she had sewn car seat covers to supplement her income. Her brother is also driver and runs a taxi service in the capital city of the province.

Chinzorig is a hardworking person and is known by her customers for her good character. For the future she hopes to have her own work place with a sustainable operation. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to make full repairs to her car.

loans.use: To make full repairs to her car

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man who has worked freelance in construction since 2009, with seven years of experience in the cement field. He lives in Tyre, and is engaged. While cash flow is the major problem he faces in his work, his experience is good, and his clients like dealing with him in many different fields. Everyone who knows him believes that he’s going to have a bright future.

Ali previously dealt with Al Majmoua, which greatly impacted him. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to complete building what he has started; he needs sand, pebbles and cement. Ali hopes to expand his business and to increase his income so as to improve his family’s situation as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy sand, pebbles and cement

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar P. is 50 years old and lives with his wife, who is a lawyer, and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His oldest son currently attends university, and his teenage son attends a local high school.

Batbaatar operates a small wood products production business in his home. He started his wood products business in 2008 after working as a guard at a bank. By managing and conducting his business successfully, he has been able to achieve a stable operation in a short time. He has used his earnings to improve his quality of life as well as to pay his son's tuition fees.

Batbaatar is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more timber and necessary supplies for his wood items production business. He is a friendly, responsible and hardworking businessman and says, "My dream is to send both of my children abroad to receive an international education." In the future Batbaatar hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more wood and necessary supplies

loans.name: Fouzia Iqbal Khan's Group

texts.en:
A caring lady, Fouzia I. K. is a housewife as well as a working woman. She is married to I. K. who has a grocery shop in the market where he sells items for daily use such as cooking oil, rice, soaps and spices. They live in the mid-sized city of Punjab called Vehari that is famous for its agricultural industry in Pakistan.

Fouzia sells milk from her home. Presently, she has a dairy cow from which she gets a good quantity of milk and makes good money every month as well.

Fouzia has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy groceries in greater quantity for his shop. She hopes that through this investment her husband will be able to serve his clients better and make more of an income. She is confident that with the improvement of her husband’s business, her family will soon enjoy a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's shop

loans.name: Siddiqa Faiz Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqa F. A. is a very caring mother who is raising her children very well. She is a housewife who stays at home handling her household responsibilities. She has proved herself a responsible wife who is always ready to support her husband in any difficult time.

Siddiqa and her husband, F. A., live in Vehari, a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan that is famous for its agricultural industry. F. is involved with livestock. He buys young goats and buffalo from animal markets at a cheap rate and then raises them for resale. His client base is butchers. He supplies them with animals and earns a good profit this way.

Siddiqa has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy goats and buffalo and increase the income of his business. Siddiqa is hopeful that with the growth of her husband’s business, her family’s standard of living will improve.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and resell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima A. is married to Joel, 53 years old, who works as a driver to earn his living and also assists in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 13 to 25 years old. The family lives in Purok Roadside within the barangay of Punta Salong, a part of Manapla municipality, Negros Occidental province on the Visayas islands. Fatima earns a living by both running a frozen food business and fattening pigs.

Fatima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past fourteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fatima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more piglets and stocks of frozen food so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Fatima A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and stocks of frozen food

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shadan Abdul Razaq's Group

texts.en:
Shadan A. R. is a housewife who spends most of her time at home handling her household responsibilities. She is raising her children well. Shadan is a resident of Vehari, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its agricultural industry.

Shadan’s husband’s name is A. R.. He is a private entrepreneur who deals with animals. He buys animals at a cheap price and then raises them at his home to sell to his clients, primarily to different butcher shops. He earns a good profit on each animal’s sale.

Shadan has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With the loan her husband will buy young animals such as goats and buffalo for his business. Shadan is hopeful that through this investment her husband’s income will definitely grow and yield good profits as well.

Shadan remains worried about her family’s financial future, but now with the loan she hopes that her family’s financial condition will improve.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa P. s 47 years old, married and has one child. She is from the village of Bago, a part of Sindangan municipality, Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Josefa plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been in business for over 29 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Josefa is requesting a new loan, her third, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita D. is 46 years old, married and has three children. She is from the village of Dicoyong, a part of Sindangan municipality, Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Amelita runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008 Amelita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan, her sixth from PMPC, of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en:
Achraf is a 35-year-old single man living in Tyre. He has been the owner of an educational tutoring center since 2004 and has twelve years of tutoring experience. Achraf helps students improve their knowledge and grasp important things poorly understood. He works in any language and in any major.

Achraf is experienced in his field because he used to teach in other schools and centers. Now he owns his own study center. His clients are his neighbors and relatives’ children, plus those from nearby schools. One of the difficulties in his business is to convince students that this center has been built for their benefit.

This is the first time Achraf is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. He would like to improve his business by buying forty extra desks and an LCD projector. Achraf believes that the loan will improve his ability to teach effectively and to obtain knowledge in the center.

Achraf hopes not only to expand his business and attract more students, but to enlarge his means of teaching with newly-updated worldwide knowledge as well.

loans.use: To buy forty extra desks and an LCD projector

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina belongs to Vehari, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, that is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives in the housing colony of Vehari named 575/EB in a three-room brick house.  

She is married to Z. A., who has a business of selling fertilizer and seeds. He has a shop in the market and has a good number of farmer contacts, particularly for selling his products.  

Sakina is a housewife. She spends all day staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy fertilizer and seeds in bulk quantities for selling through his shop. Buying items in bulk will cut his cost of purchasing and make him able to meet urgent orders on time.  

Sakina is hopeful that with the help of this investment, her husband will successfully be able to grow the business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds in bulk quantities for selling

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri D., age 41, lives with his wife and two daughters in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. He and his family live in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian housing tent. 

Batsuuri and his wife operate a clothing and consumer goods trade business in their community. They provide a variety of clothing items and consumer goods to satisfy their customers' needs. They have been operating their shop in a rented space after moving from countryside. After only a short period of operation, they have have attained success in their new business and have built up a stable operation. In the future, they plan to expand their shop by renting a larger-sized space in which to do business. Their earnings have enabled them to improve their family's standard of living.  

Batsuuri is a very modest and hardworking person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of clothes and goods at wholesale prices from Narantuul, a large, main market in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes and goods for sale

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Enhbold G., age 39, lives with his wife and two children in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, a primary city in Mongolia. The family lives together in their own apartment. His oldest son attends the local high school while Enhbold and his wife operate the family business. 

They own a small bicycle repair and car parts trading business in their town. They have been engaged in this business for past 12 years and have built a sustainable operation. At first, the couple rented a small room for workplace, but after a year of successful business operation, they managed to buy the new house and fence in 2008 and expand their services. They business is located in a popular spot, which attracts more customers. In the future, they are planning to provide more services such as motorcycle and automobile repair services. 

He is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more bicycle parts when prices for those products are cheap.

loans.use: To purchase more bicycle parts to use in his shop

texts.en:
Jocelyn A., from the village of Disud, is 48 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Jocelyn is just starting this business.

In 2007, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, Jocelyn is requesting her eighth loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina B. is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a lecturer and they have two children, 4 and 9 years old. Selina owns a cement distribution shop, where she supplies builders around the Kitengela area, an upcoming residential area where many buildings are being constructed.  Besides this business, she also has a container which she rents out to other people to use as a shop. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she faces is competition from many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers. She says that there are other people in Kitengela who are well established and own big hardware stores and even provide transport facilities. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy more bags of cement to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to develop her business by opening a big hardware store and owning lorries to provide transport facilities to her customers. She describes herself as hardworking, flexible and business-minded.

loans.use: to buy cement

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en: Batmunh M. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is currently unemployed and looks after their three young children at home. Batmunh operates a taxi service in his town. He has been driving a taxi since 2000 and has gained much experience. After several successful years of operation, he used his earnings to buy a new car in 2008. He has taken out leasing loans from XacBank twice in the past and has proven himself to be a trustworthy customer who always pays on time and in full. He used his loans to purchase a refrigerator, beds, etc. worth 600,000 MNT. With his earnings, he is able to provide for his family. He says, "I am now preparing for the coming extreme winter by purchasing firewood and coal." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase items such as winter tires, oil, etc. for his car.

loans.use: to purchase items for his car

texts.en: Batsuuri S. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his daughters are university students while his son is handicapped and stays at home with his wife. Batsuuri sells water to households and organizations in his town that are too far away from the town well. He started this business in 2005 using his horse cart. Since then, his business has been successful enough to purchase a new car for water deliveries. His monthly revenue is between 180,000 and 250,000 MNT. He tries to provide pure water in sanitary containers. Batsuuri is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase new barrels for his water delivery business.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne A. is a married lady with five children. Her husband is a self-employed electrician. Her business is located at Pipeline, in a residential area, and she is served by the Kitengela Branch. 

She owns a Salon that is well-known by the name Weavers Salon. Her target market is women and children (girls). She has been in this business for two years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are a lot of competing businesses in the area and  customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business going well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more hair treatments, oil and hair-dryers to meet customer demand. In the future, she hopes to grow her business by owning a big salon and opening a beauty college. She describes herself as hardworking, flexible and business-minded.
