loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 19 years old single lady from Tyre, with 4 years of experience working as a makeup artist.  Zahra is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for two reasons; she needs to buy a professional hair dryer chair, in addition to beauty cosmetics and tools; Zahra also wants to pay for her brother’s school fees. Zahra previous loan was to improve her business and had an excellent effect on expanding it and improving her family’s financial situation. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and relatives. She attends several workshops, to stay up to date with what is preferred worldwide. She is willing to improve and expand her beauty center to attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy professional hair dryer chair, cosmetics.

loans.name: Hudoykul

texts.ru: Фармонов Худойкул проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын, учится в экономическом университете Таджикистана. Сам Худойкул, имеет высшее образование, экономист. Занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Hudoykul F. lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 44 years old, married and has 5 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  His son attends an economics university in Tajikistan.  Hudoykul has a higher education, as an economist.  He is involved in agriculture.  He leases a plot of land, where he grows vegetables.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Emprendedoras nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar, y comentaron sobre los beneficios del programa para las señoras e invitaron para integrar los grupos.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de Guarambaré,  fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Julia M., presidenta del grupo tiene 35 años, ella esta domiciliada en Guarambaré, allí también tiene su  taller de cotillón, y es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora.
Ella es una señora muy emprendedora y trabaja mucho para el bienestar de su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su cotillo como juguetes, bandejitas, regalos, piñatas y otros.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedoras Group was started with the support of another group that was working in the same place and told them about the benefits of the program for the women and invited them to join. This group is from the city of Guarambaré, and their main goal is the growth of each member--socially and economically. They are known in their region as very hard-working women.

Mrs. Julia M., the group's president, is 35 years old and lives in Guarambaré where she has her party favor workshop. She is a hard-working and innovative woman and works a lot for her family's well-being. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her party favor store like toys, dishes, gifts, piñatas and others.

loans.use: To buy toys, gift-making supplies, piñatas, and other birthday merchandise

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul, an entrepreneur from Isfara, Tajikistan, sells fabric merchandise in the central mall of her hometown. In this business for 19 years, Ugul is seeking a loan of $3000 USD to purchase additional inventory for further retail sale in her little store. She is hoping to buy new, trendy fabrics that sell well among numerous mall customers.

Ugul can be characterized as a solvent borrower quite capable of loan repayment. She has gained a reputation for responsibility both in her financial obligations and in keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for the business

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
La  Sra. Geronima es casada con 2 hijos mayores . Ella se dedica a la despensa que tiene en su domicilio ,trabajo desD. muy pequeña con su madre D. quien aprendió el oficio,luego D. mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar una pequeña despensa que con el tiempo fue creciendo.
Necesita D. este crédito para comprar D. mas mercaderías  preparando para las fiesta D. fin D. años, como sidras y otras bebidad D. la espoca, ademas D. panficados, aceites, verduras y frutas.  
Sueña con abrir un super en su barrio y dar mas fuente D. trabajo en su barrio .
texts.en: Mrs. Geronima is married with 2 young children.  She works at a store that she has in her home.  She started as a young girl and learned the traD. from her mother.  Later, after a lot of effort and dedication, she was able to start her own small store that has been growing.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to prepare for New Year's Eve parties, like ciders and other traditional beverages.  She will also buy breads, oils, vegetables, and fruits.  She dreams of opening a larger store in her neighborhood and providing more jobs for her neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy cider, sugar, noodles, breads, etc.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en:
J. Abdullo is 49 years old, married and has three children. For the past six years, he has been a welder. In the cold season he takes orders for small stoves. He is also sells them at the market. Now it is the beginning of the cold season and many people are coming to Abdullo to order stoves. In Tajikistan in winter, electricity and gas are limited, so stoves are needed. Abdullo has applied for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase the necessary materials to make his stoves. With your help, he will be able to make his business succeed and provide his children with an education. Your generosity can change their lives. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase necessary materials to make small stoves.

loans.name: Atayi

texts.en: Atayi R. is in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She is 27 years old and married to a student. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima and her family own a family business which they started three years ago. The family saved money to start the bakery where they live in Askar refugee camp which is next to Nablus city. 
Fatima has three young boys and her husband Haitham has a transporting car he uses as a second source of income and to deliver bakery orders.

The bakery's reputation brings an increasing number of customers, Fatima wants to enhance the efficiency by purchasing dough cutting machine to reduce time and increase production, therefore she came to FATEN and took a $3,000 loan for this purpose.

Fatima's husband Haitham stands in front of the bakery in the picture here as she is a conservative woman and doesn't like her picture to be published.

loans.use: Purchase dough cutting machine

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a married woman with two children both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity. 

For over seven years, she has operated her kiosk/shop where she sells maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice. She faces major competition from other retailers in the market selling similar goods. Caren hopes to buy a piece of land to build a permanent house.

Her reason for working with Yehu is because of its good reputation in the community and easy accessibility of loans. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en: Tarek is a 34-year-old single man from Tyre, who works selling and fixing car tires. He started in 1998 and has 15 years experience. Tarek is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua to buy an improved wheel-fixing machine and an air compressor — both necessary to his business. He hopes to expand his business and buy new improved machines.

loans.use: To buy a new wheel-fixing machine and air compressor

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice K. runs a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods like bags of sugar and cartons of salt.  Alice is 45 years old and married to a business man. She has three children in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more goods like sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva D. is currently in the business of selling fish and sugar and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Eva is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has five children and three of her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a mother of two daughters and two sons. As Maha is widowed, she takes care of her family. Therefore she took over her husband's work and started running the grocery store he used to own. Three of her children are school students while the forth (Issam who is shown in the picture as Maha doesn't want her picture published) helps her run the store.

Maha took a $3,000 loan from FATEN to buy groceries to sell in the store to increase the returns and help her cover her household and childrens' school expenses. The store is located in the old city of Nablus.

loans.use: Purchase grocery store goods

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. currently sells beer. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more crates of beer to sell. Betty is 28 years old; she is married to a businessman. She has three children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchasing more crates of beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing more fish to sell

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa is a 39 year old single man from Tyre. He has worked as an electrician since 2000. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua,, so that he can buy necessary electricA. tools and do necessary electricA. maintenance to his parents’ house. His clients are not limited; they can be anyone who needs such a service. He is working on expanding his work to a wider range of construction.

loans.use: purchasing electrical tools

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with five children, four of whom graduated while one still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She has operated her juice selling business for over 18 years. She sells to passersby and her neighboring community. Mwanatumu faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the winter rainy season, the demand for natural juice is very low compared to summer season. She hopes to purchase a pick up truck for light transport. 

With the Kshs 80,000 loan she wants to purchase window shutters for her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase window shutters for her rental houses

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola M. is 20 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband is employed as a driver.  Viola is currently in the business of selling cassava beans at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity G. is 40 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom are in school.  Her husband is a soldier. Charity is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim, coffee, etc. She  is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of simsim to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cases of Fanta sodas, and of Mutzig and Primus beers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnest D. is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Agnest is currently in the business of selling bread, sugar, and cooking oil in a shop at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti T. is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and transport costs. Mwanasiti has operated her tailoring business from home for the last four years.  She faces the major challenge of high competition from other tailoring shops. In the future she would like to build rental houses to increase her income.  Mwanasiti decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from friends. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase a bale of cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mshikamano Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Maria C. is in her early twenties and is married with one child. Maria has been running her own business with chickens that lay eggs for the past three years. The business is open daily between 5:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. and earns Maria a moderate monthly profit.

This will be Maria's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. With this loan, Maria hopes to buy more chickens, as well as chicken feed. Maria's dream is to one day open a shop where she can sell food wholesale.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group, Mshikamano, that totals sixteen members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loan.

In the picture, Maria can be seen standing in the back row, third from the right.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer volvio a formarse gracias ala gestión dela Señora Lorena B. y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Capiatá,  estas señoras tiene bien en claro sus metas  son  muy trabajadoras.
 Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el comité  anterior ya que dos de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente su comité.
La Presidenta Lorena B. trabaja en un Restaurant  en Asuncio.
Ella trabaja solo algunos días de la semana y esos días que no trabaja quiere dedicarse a la venta de comidas en su propio domicilio ya que tiene la posibilidad de preparar y de vender.
Tiene tres hijos todos entran en la escuela vive.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que ella utiliza para la elaboración de comestibles.
texts.en:
The Renacer (Rebirth) group was restarted thanks to the help of Mrs. Lorena B. and the support of another group that was working in the same place. This group is from Capiatá, and these women have very well-defined goals and are very hard-working. The group has overcome a very difficult struggle, as two of the members did not make their weekly payments. They canceled the loan and assumed the responsibility of restarting their group.

Lorena B., the group's president, works in a restaurant in Asuncio. She only works on week days and on the days she does not work in the restaurant, she works selling food from her home since she has the skill to prepare and sell. She has three children and they are all studying. She is asking for the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make the food.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, especially meat, to make food

loans.name: Liela

texts.en:
Leila V. is thirty years old and is married; her husband is a business man. She has eight children and they all go to school.

Leila currently runs a small business selling fish, onions and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock clothes to sell as well.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Venezuela Group

texts.en:
Aranyaeli U. is in his early forties and is married with four children. Aranyaeli has been running his own transportation business for the past nine years. He owns a bajaji (rickshaw) and a tipper (dump truck). He runs his business daily between 9:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. and it earns Aranyaeli a good monthly profit.

This will be Aranyaeli's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to build his savings and buy land. With this loan, Aranyaeli hopes to begin building on his land.

Aranyaeli will share this loan with his loan group, Venezuela, that totals seventeen members. Aranyaeli serves as the secretary of the group. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loan.

In the picture, Aranyaeli can be seen seated on the far right, in a blue shirt.

loans.use: To start building on some land he previously purchased

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria 26 es madre de 2 hijos menores .
Ella se dedica a la confección prendas de vestir para dama ,caballeros y niños ,trabajó desde muy pequeña con su madre de quien aprendió el oficio, luego de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar un pequeño taller con  tres maquinas.
Ella necesita de este crédito para comprar telas en cantidad y de esta  manera abaratar el costo de sus prendas. 
María    desea  abrir un salón y exhibir sus prendas.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 and the mother of two underage children.
She makes clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. She has worked since she was small with her mother, who taught her the trade. After much effort and dedication she succeeded in setting up a small workshop with three machines. 
She needs this loan to buy cloth in quantity and in this way reduce the price of the clothes.
Maria wants to open a shop to exhibit her clothing.

loans.use: To buy cloth, thread, glue, buttons, zippers, emroidered strips.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean K. is 39 years old and is married; her husband is a farmer. She has five children who all go to school.

Jean is currently in the business of selling beer, soda and rice from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Jean hopes to be able to stock clothes to sell as well.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Theresa Chebet

texts.en:
Theresa Chebet S., 52 years old, is married to Kipketer Mitei, a farmer. They are blessed with three children aged 38, 36 and 26 years old. They live in Kipkaren estate within the town of Eldoret, Kenya.

Theresa operates a hotel. She has been in business for the past six years with an income of 12,000 KES a month.

Theresa was introduced to KADET by a friend. She is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES with KADET after paying her previous loan successfully. With this loan she plans to buy five bundles of baking flour, 30 liters of cooking oil and use the remaining amount to renovate the hotel.

She hopes to expand her hotel and in the future to extend her business to the city center.

loans.use: To buy five bundles of baking flour, 30 liters of cooking oil and to renovate her hotel

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He has made his living as an experienced construction worker. He has specialized in home construction for the past 25 years. He works on an average of two home projects per month, and he is thankful for his business income.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new construction tools to replace his old ones so as to improve his business expertise and ready himself for a new home project. As with the majority of Lebanese fathers, his main target is to satisfy the demands of his family.

In the future, he is planning to continue expanding his business and take on more projects per month to make more money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools

loans.name: Peres Chepkinyor

texts.en:
Peres Chepkinyor K. is a 63 year old lady married to James K.; they have five children, ages 42, 40, 38, 35, 22 and 20. They live in Kipkaren in Eldoret- Kenya. Peres has been in the grocery store business for the past four years, where she earns an income of Kshs.6,000 per month.

Peres was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her second loan of Kshs.15,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan she plans to buy tomatoes, onion, vegetables, Fruits and irish potatoes.

She hopes to expand her business and operate a large scale grocery.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, vegetables and irish potatoes.

loans.name: Florence Ilamwenya

texts.en:
Florence Ilamwenya W., 48 years old, is a skilled and experienced busines lady, who has longstanding relationships with her school and pupils. She operates her own private school in Eldoret-Kenya, where she earns a living. She is married to Polycar Luyali; they have four children, ages 26, 24, 20 and 18.

Florence has been in this business for the past six years and generates an income of Kshs.18,000 per month. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her second loan of Kshs.25,000 with KADET LTD. With her loan she plans to buy more desks for the classroom.

In the future, she hopes in future to expand her high school.

loans.use: To buy more desks for the classroom

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en:
Bidala is a married woman with three children all of whom graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchasing of business license.

She has operated her restaurant business for over seven years, selling to passersby and the neighbouring community. Bidala faces the challenge of theft cases in her business. She hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase three sacks of beans, a bundle of maize flour and cooking fat to be used in the restaurant. She decided to work with Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of beans, a bundle of maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Irene Adhiambo

texts.en:
Irene Adhiambo A. is 24 years old, married to Maurice Odhiambo Mudenyo who is a mechanic and is a source of additional income for the family. They have one 3 year old child. Their reside in Turner Baker in Kitale-Kenya. She operates in a hardware store selling auto paints and has been in this business for the past two years, earning a monthly profit of Kshs.15,000.

Irene learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and so she is applying for her first loan of Kshs.20,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to buy 10 boxes of paints to add as stock. She plans to purchase her own store with the anticipated profits.

In the future, Irene wishes to expand her business by bringing in a computer to mix colors and to also have the rental houses. Her deeper desire is to see her children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of paints.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de Capiata, y tiene dos años de antiguedad con  intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Han pasado por una prueba muy difíciles ya muchas socias en ocasiones no cumplen con las responsabilidades que cada una tiene. 
Una de las integrantes es las señora Maria quien se dedica a la compra  y venta de bebidas en una cantina que tiene en su casa.
Con esta actividad ella obtiene buenos ingresos y piensa preparan y recargar con una buena cantidad y variedad de mercaderias para fin de años.
Para ello solicita el prestamo mediate el comité que conforma ella y sus amigas.
Comenta que se siente muy orgullosa de formar parte del grupo ya que además del préstamo, ellas fomentan la unios y la ayuda solidarias entre todas, y las ayuda mucho para en lo personal.
texts.en:
This group is from Capiata and has been around for two years. With intense work, it has grown socially as well as economically. They are recognized in the area as hard-working women.
They have been through difficult trials since many of the members, on occasion, do not meet their responsibilities.
One of the members is Maria, who buys and sells drinks in a bar that she has in her home. 
With this activity, she obtains good income and is thinking of preparing and restocking a large quantity of varied merchandise for the end of the year. 
So, she is seeking the loan through the group made up of her and her friends.
She comments that she feels very proud to be part of the group since, beyond the loan, they encourage unity, help and solidarity among each other, and help each other in personal issues as well.

loans.use: To buy drinks such as beer, wine, soda etc.

loans.name: Fredrick Juma

texts.en:
Fredrick Juma W. is 29 year-old man married to Mary Nekesa. They are blessed with three children,  ages ten, seven and three. They live in Kitale-Kenya. Fredrick has been transporting molasses for sale for six years, earning a monthly profit of kshs 20,000.

Fredrick is applying for a loan of Kshs 25,000, which will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He intends to use the whole loan to purchase six tonnes of molasses for transportation. He intends to use the profit to make bricks for building his home.

In the future, Fredrick hopes to diversify into selling fuel and operating a posho mill. He hopes to have a better life for himself and his family

loans.use: To purchase six tonnes of molasses for transportation

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is a university student and a sister of five brothers and one sister, her father is an employee of the Ministry of Waqf and religious affairs. Three of Ala's brothers study in the university, Ala came to FATEN and took a $600 loan to pay her and her brother's tuition fees. 
Ala's family also own a piece of land where she and her mother work and grow vegetables to become a second source of income.
Ala's dad Ibrahim appears in the picture here as Ala is very shy to have her picture published.

loans.use: Pay tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of 4 school-age children.  She has been running a clothing and shoes store for the past eight years. She only sells women's and children's clothes. Her business income is very vital for her family because she helps her husband with the household in addition to paying school fees. She is requesting a $1200 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to expand her store’s inventory. This will be her second loan and it will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell men's clothing and shoes from her store.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Dinayda

texts.es:
La señora Dinayda  es divorciada, el esposo la abandonó hace varios años; vive con sus 2 hijos que se encuentran en estudiando en primaria, vive en casa  de sus padres en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente trabaja repartiendo víveres al contado y crédito y también en una imprenta compaginando libros, es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar..
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar su mercadería de víveres y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Dinayda is divorced; her husband abandoned her a few years ago. She lives with her two children who are attending primary school. She lives in her parents’ home in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone in the city of La Paz.
She works distributing groceries for cash or credit and also works at a printer’s binding books, which is how she obtains income for her home.
The loan sought is to increase her stock of merchandise and so be able to increase her income.
It is her first loan. The socioeconomic analysis performed rates her favorably, so she is able to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of provisions such as rice, sugar and oil for sale to her clients.

loans.name: Naida

texts.es:
La Sra. Naida tiene 26 años. Es soltera, vive con sus padres en  Fernando de la Mora.
La Sra. Naida se dedica a la compra venta de perfumes, jeans, remeras, camisas, etc. hace 6 años.
Ella tambien se dedica a la enseñanza en una escuela en  Fernando de la Mora. 
 La Sra. Naida necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderìas como jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones, en cantidad a menor precio. 
 En el futuro desea abrir un local en su domicilio  donde se concentra su mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Naida is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents in Fernando de la Mora.
For the last six years, Maida has bought and sold perfume, jeans, t-shirts, shirts etc.
She also teaches in a school in Fernando de la Mora.
Naida needs this loan to buy more merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts and pants in larger quantities at cheaper prices.
In the future she wants to open a shop in her home, around where most of her customers are concentrated.

loans.use: To buy jeans, t-shirts, perfume, shirts etc.

loans.name: Rukarara Development, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
K. Amiria is a hard working former agriculturalist who has raised capital and started a rice selling business in Kihihi town. The 29 
year old married mother of 4 children has good clientele relationships, which has gotten her business many regular customers.

Her main challenge currently is low stock. Therefore, she plans to buy more stock for resale for her business with this loan. She is very optimistic about expanding her business and improving her family's standard of living in the near future.

Amiria belongs to Rukarara development group, whose members hold each other accountable for paying back loans.

loans.use: Purchase of more stock of rice

loans.name: Murehe Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Mariko A.'s main source of livelihood for the past 5 years has been selling food stuffs like maize grains, groundnuts, and sorghum in Murehe trading centre, Kihihi. It is with earnings from this business that the hard working and determined A. Mariko has managed to sustain his family of 2 children. The 27 year old dynamic business man has reached a point where profits accruing to his business now amount to 150,000 Ugandan shillings in a month. With steadying progress in building his small enterprise, he reckons his future prospects are rising every passing day.
With a loan coming his way, Mariko carries conviction that he will be able to buy more food crops produce like maize and beans so that he does not run short of stock and supplies as he looks towards owning a big produce store in the area. This will improve his sales revenue and enable him to lead a self sustaining life as he looks towards educating his children and they become important people who can support themselves in the near future.

He belongs to Murehe Tukwatanise group, Kihihi.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga se dedica al servicio D. alquileres D. vajillas, decoración para eventos y servicio D. bufett  desD. el año 1980. Inicialmente solo trabajaba con alquiler D. sillas mesas, manteles y vajillas en general. 
Con el tiempo y el aumento  D. pedidos D. servicios fue incorporando las decoraciones y por ultimo el servicio D. bufett.
Ella tiene 51 años, ya no tiene hijos menores D. edad. Hace poco mas D. un año enviudó, por lo que sus hijos la impulsaron a abrir un nuevo negocio en su domicilio, para poder aumentar sus ingresos, pues quedó sola con todas las responsabilidades del hogar. 
Actualmente cuenta con un pequeño salón en el que funciona una Boutique. 
Este crédito será D. mucha ayuda para ella, pues necesita adquirir prendas para la temporada veraniega que inicia y asi satisfacer   los pedidos D. su clientela .Desea  comprar , vestidos, shorts,  remeras, camisas, soleras. 
Su anhelo es poder dejar a sus nietos una microempresa para que los mismos aprendan a ser  emprendedores y sepan generar  sus propios ingresos .
texts.en:
Since 1980, Olga has been renting tableware and decorations for events as well as providing buffet services. Initially she only rented chairs, tables, tablecloths and general tableware.
With time and an increase in demand for her services, she gradually added the decorations, and finally the buffet service.
She is 51 years old and does not have any children who are still minors. A little over a year ago she became a widow, so her children encouraged her to open a new business out of her home to increase her income, since she was now alone facing all the home responsibilities. 
Currently she has a small room out of which she operates a boutique.
The loan will be very helpful to her, since she needs to acquire clothes for the summer season that is starting, and thus meet her customers’ requests. She wants to buy dresses, shorts, t-shirts, shirts and sundresses.
Her desire is to leave her grandchildren a microenterprise so that they learn to be entrepreneurs and know how to generate their own income.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the season, such as t-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young for school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is high transportation costs. 

Fatuma has been selling Khangas (garments) for the last three years. She sells door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs. She travels from Kenya to Tanzania to purchase Khangas of good quality, hence the high transportation costs incurred. She hopes to open a shop to sell Khangas in the future. 

Her major reason for working with Yehu is because of its accessibility to sustainable financial services. With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase a bundle of Khanga's and clothes for women and children for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of Khanga's and clothes for women and children for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Success To One Group

texts.en:
Mondyu Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Success To One. She is 47 years old, married and has four children who are between the ages of 14 and 25 years. She also cares for one sibling. She was only able to attend school through tenth grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a determined woman.

For sixteen years Mondyu has been selling fish, meat, chicken and pigs’ feet in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish, meat, chicken and pigs’ feet. Her goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, meat, chicken and pigs' feet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish, meat, chicken, bags of rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over six years, Esther has operated her tailoring business, which includes fabric, shoes and handbags for sale. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the holiday seasons (August and December) the demand for fabric items is high compared to the months of January through May when the demand is very low.

Esther decided to join Yehu so as to get financial assistance. With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a bundle of cloth, shoes and handbags for resale. She hopes to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, shoes and handbags for resale

loans.name: Twuzuzanye Group

texts.fr: Deogratias AG., un des membres du groupe Twuzuzanye ces membres sont tous commerçants, il est mariée, il a 26 ans. Son niveau d’étude est tronc commun secondaire, il a 1 enfant de deux ans et demi. Il est commerçant avec experience dans ce domaine de 4ans. Deogratias et son groupe s’organisent pour augmenter leur force financière, et valoriser leur business. En fait, le groupe a contracté n prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business quant à lui c’est pour acheter l’huile, savons, sucre,... le profit venant de leur commerce une partie est réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et une autre est épargnée afin de préparer pour le bon futur des familles.
texts.en: Deogratias AG. is a member of the Twuzuzanye group composed of entrepreneurs, is married and 26 years of age. He has finished the general academic part of secondary  school cycle. He has a child 2.5 years old. He is an entrepreneur with four years of experience. Deogratias and his group join their forces to strengthen their financial capital and grow their business. The group has taken out [one] loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in order to restock goods needed in their business—in Deogratias’ case, this means oil, soap, sugar etc. A part of the profit is reinvested in order to maintain financial stability of the group and the other is put away in savings in order to plan for a better future for their families.

loans.use: Purchasing oil, soap, sugar etc to retail in his store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of oranges, mangoes, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, butter, biscuits, eggs, bread, tea, candy, soap, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
Mariana de 34 años de edad, reside en San Buena Ventura, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y vive con su hijo de 5 años pues es madre soltera.
Ella tiene una tortillería en el mercado municipal desde hace 12 años, trabajando de lunes a domingos de diez de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, este negocio fue iniciativa propia ya que tenía que ver la forma de sobrevivir y dar a su hijo lo necesario para su desarrollo; Ella solicita un préstamo el cual lo necesita para compra de maíz por sacos y encontrarlo en mejores precios de esta manera contar con un inventario de materia prima que le permita contar con maíz por varios meses.
Este préstamo ayudara a que Mariana cuente con el material principal para atender a los clientes y satisfacer la demanda incrementando de esta manera sus ventas y los ingresos ya que son los únicos con los que cuenta para mantenerse ella y a su hijo.
Los objetivos de ella son varios, entre ellos está el crecer como comerciante, aumentar el número de clientes y trabajar mucho para que su hijo pueda estudiar y prepararse para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mariana is 34 years old and lives in San Buena Ventura, located in the department of Usulután. She works selling tortillas and lives with her 5-year-old son, as she is a single mother.

For the past 12 years, she has had a tortilla stand at the municipal market where she works from Monday to Sunday from 10am to 5pm. The business was her own initiative since she needs a way to survive and provide her son with what he needs for his development. Mariana is requesting a loan which she needs to buy sacks of corn and to find them at the best price. This way, she will have a stock of supplies that will allow her to have enough corn to last several months.

This loan will help Mariana to have the supplies needed to attend to her customers and meet their demand, thus increasing her sales and income. These sales are the only sources of income that she has to support herself and her son.

Mariana has several goals. Among them are to grow as a merchant, to increase her number of customers, and to work a lot so that her son can study and prepare himself for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Destino de Crédito: Compra de una computadora para estudios de Diseño Grafico.
Mary  reside en vivienda propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separada y tiene un hijo que estudia Diseño Grafico; Mary es profesora en una Unidad Educativa de esta ciudad, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia.

El crédito que saco anteriormente fue para la refacción de pisos en su vivienda, es cliente de Impro con un historial de 5 créditos.  El préstamo que ahora solicita es para la compra de una computadora para su hijo, pues como el muchacho estudia Diseño gráfico, es muy importante que tenga una computadora donde pueda usar los programas relacionados a su profesión. Mary se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que le otorgamos y esta vez el crédito será procesado a través de Kiva.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Loan use: To buy a computer for Graphic Design studies.  Mary lives in her own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area, on the west side of the city of La Paz.  She is separated and has one son who is studying Graphic Design.  Mary is a teacher at a school in this city, and she supports her family with her salary.

The last loan that she received was to refurbish the floors in her house.  She is a client of Impro and has received 5 loans in the past.  The current loan that she is requesting is to buy a computer for her son. Since he is studying Graphic Design, it’s very important that he have a computer where he can use programs related to his profession.  Mary is happy with the loans given her and this time the loan will be processed through Kiva.

By her credit history she qualifies to receive a new loan since she is considered a good client.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her son's studies in Graphic Design

loans.name: Abarihamwe Women's, Ntungamo Group

texts.en: K. Nathan, 45 years old, of Abarihamwe Women's group is very optimistic about expanding his current kitchen wares sales business. The hardworking and cordial married father of six children has been operating his business for the last 14 years from Muko Ward, Ntungamo. He regularly earns 300,000 UGX monthly with sales from items such as glasses, plates, cups, food flasks, saucepans and other utensils. Because of his need to make his business grow, he is seeking a loan that will help him establish substantial growth through purchasing more stock in order to be able to supply his clients more efficiently. He will be able then to make more sales revenue which will enable him to pay his family bills, including his children's education fees.

loans.use: purchase of more stock

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: El señor Fortunato nacido el 14 de octubre en Florida provincia cordillera casado con La Sra.  Sabina  con 4 hijos que estudian y también le ayudan en la siembra y cosecha a su Papa, hace 20 años que vive en villa florida a 11 km. De la carretera entrando por San Luis hacia la pampa el Cosal el se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería el señor cuenta con una parcela de 48 hectáreas dotación de la reforma agraria pero actualmente esta saneada por el Inra(Instituto Nacional de reforma Agraria), el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la siembra de Maíz y Maní, también para el preparado  de la tierra antes de la siembra, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fortunado was born on October 14th in Florida in the Cordillera province. He and his wife Sabina have four children who study and help him with planting and harvesting his potatoes. For 20 years he has lived in Villa Florida which is located 11 kilometers from the San Luis highway. He works as a farmer and a cattle rancher. He has 48 hectacres of land which were awarded to him through agrarian reform, but it is currently being drained by the INRA (National Institute of Agrian Reform). The loan money will be used to plant corn and peanuts, as well as to prepare the land before the planting. He is very thankful for the support.

loans.use: Planting corn and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of flour, butter, sugar, yeast etc.

loans.name: Kawama Omunaku Group-Jinja

texts.en: The parable about talents teaches that most people lack the confidence to do something because they are afraid of failure. There are many such people in Uganda but 32-year-old N. Safina is an exception as she has always had self-confidence and belief in herself. These attributes have worked for her in her two reliable means of subsistence: a hotel and a fresh food sales business in Bugembe-Jinja. She credits her husband for encouraging her, even while she was a housewife. In a month, her profits total up to 200,000 UGX and with this loan she is looking at purchasing more fresh foods for her hotel. She belongs to the Kawama Omunaku group-Jinja.

loans.use: to purchase fresh foods for her hotel

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Señor Juan hace 20 años que se vino a buscar mejor vida a Santa Cruz el es de Cochabamba y por falta de trabajo fue a Santa Cruz,   casado con  la Sra. Mercedes  no tienen hijos pero ellos se dedican a la agricultura juntamente con su esposa ellos trabajan en Nuevo Surutu distante a 40 km. Del torno hacia el oeste ellos salen unas ves por mes al mercado del Torno para comercializar sus productos, son muy trabajadores desean pronto agrandar su familia con hijos, con el dinero del crédito  compraran semillas y también lo utilizaran en el preparado de la tierra, esta muy agradecido de la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan came to Santa Cruz from Cochabamba 20 years ago to find a better life.  He’s married to Mercedes, but they don’t have any children yet.  They are farmers and work in Nuevo Surutu, 40 kilometers west of Torno.  Once a month they go to the Torno marketplace to sell their products.  They are hard workers and are looking forward to building their family and have children.  They will use the money from this loan to buy seed and to prepare the land.  He is very thankful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: Seeds

loans.name: Mpasha Bamwe Group B, Ibanda

texts.en: A member of Mpasha Bamwe group, Mataya T. is a hardworking and determined married father of one child.  Mataya has been operating a butchery business for over four years from Mpasha trading centre, Ibanda, having established it with loan money from a financial institution and savings from his previous farming business.  He is requesting this loan to purchase more goats for slaughtering as he looks to increase his profits in order to pay for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more goats

loans.name: Veronica Margarita

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 33 años, reside en Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija de 7 años; se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace un año, el horario de atención es de once de la mañana hasta las ocho y treinta de la noche, este negocio fue iniciativa propia siempre viendo la forma de ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Chicharrón, quesillo, repollo, aceite, que son los materiales para preparar las pupusas y las tortillas. Para ella este préstamo es muy útil pues quiere contar con suficientes productos para realizar más venta y atender a muchos clientes y solo de esta manera ella los puede adquirir ya que no cuenta con los suficientes recursos.
Las proyecciones de Verónica es crecer con las ventas, clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para ir solventando las dificultades económicas de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Verónica tiene 33 años, reside en Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija de 7 años; se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace un año, el horario de atención es de once de la mañana hasta las ocho y treinta de la noche, este negocio fue iniciativa propia siempre viendo la forma de ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Chicharrón, quesillo, repollo, aceite, que son los materiales para preparar las pupusas y las tortillas. Para ella este préstamo es muy útil pues quiere contar con suficientes productos para realizar más venta y atender a muchos clientes y solo de esta manera ella los puede adquirir ya que no cuenta con los suficientes recursos.
Las proyecciones de Verónica es crecer con las ventas, clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para ir solventando las dificultades económicas de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Soledad Sandra

texts.es: La Sra. Soledad vive en el Barrio Victoria en  casa propia en la cual tiene una venta D. abarrotes, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales asisten al colegio los cuatro, su esposo trabaja D. eventual una Fabrica  y recientemente ha abierto un taller D. Tornería donD. recién le están conociendo los clientes, el préstamo que están solicitando es para abrir otra venta D. abarrote en la avenida porque hay una feria que se realizan los jueves y domingos, la Sra. Soledad es una persona trabajadora al igual que su esposo, son responsables y con muchas ganas D. superación. Estam muy agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Soledad lives in the Victoria neighborhood in her own house where she has a grocery store installed.  She has four children all of whom are in school.  Her husband works sometimes in a factory and recently opened a metal shop where he is just starting to be known by customers.

The loan they are asking for is to open another grocery store on the avenue because there is a small market that occurs there on Thursdays and Sundays.

Soledad is a hard working person just like her husband.  They are responsible and very much want to get ahead.  They are very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.fr: Césarie Nyiransabimana, un des membres du groupe Abahuje, ces membres sont tous commerçants, elle est mariée, elle a 50 ans. Son niveau d’étude est primaire, elle a 9 enfants le grand a 26 ans et le petit a 7 ans. Elle est commerçante avec expérience dans ce domaine de 3 ans. Césarie et son groupe s’organisent pour augmenter leur force financière, et valoriser leur business. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business quant à elle, c’est pour acheter les caisses de fanta, lait, pain pour les détailler en boutique,... le profit venant de leur commerce une partie est réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et une autre est épargnée afin de préparer pour le bon futur des familles.
texts.en: Césarie Nyiransabimana belongs to the Abahuje group, all of whose members are entrepreneurs. She is married and is 50 years old. She has finished primary school. She has nine children, the oldest being 26 years of age and the youngest 7. She has three years of experience in business. Césarie and her group join forces to increase their financial strength and to grow their business. The group has taken out a loan from Amasezeraon Community Banking to restock goods needed for their business; she will use her loan to purchase cases of Fanta, milk and bread for reselling. The profit from their business is partly reinvested in order to maintain the financial stability of the group, and partly put aside to help build a better future for their families.

loans.use: Achat fanta, paix et lait,... pour les detailler

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Efraín cliente antiguo de la institución, de edad de 35 años vive en la localidad de el  Torno barrio las palmas hace 8 años, oriundo de Cochabamba.
Estado civil: concubino con la Sra. Nieves de edad 36 años cuenta con la actividad de servicio de limpieza hace 1 año en una institución de la localidad, el sr. Se dedica al  trasporte hace 15 años en Santa Cruz en un radio móvil muy conocido de la ciudad, Con el dinero del crédito realizara el mantenimiento a su movilidad ya que esta presentando algunas fallas, y no le permite brindar un servicio bueno a sus clientes.  El cliente esta agradecido por que nuevamente confiamos en ellos y agilizamos su préstamo para poder invertir en lo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Efraín is a longstanding client of the institution.  He is 35 years old and has lived in Torno’s Las Palmas neighborhood for the last 8 years.  He is from Cochabamba. 

He is in a common law marriage with Nieves, 36, who has worked as a cleaning lady in a local institution for the past year.   He has worked in transportation for a very well known radio taxi service for 15 years in Santa Cruz .

With the loan funds they will provide the vehicle with needed service and repairs because it’s starting to have some mechanical problems and he isn’t able to provide his customers with the best service.

He is grateful that once again we trust him and have facilitated his loan to invest in the things they need.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new grinder machine

loans.name: Fear Of God Group

texts.en:
M. G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Fear Of God.  He is 31 years old, married, and has one child who is four years old. He was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to financial constraints. 
For eight years, he has been selling milk, butter, biscuits, eggs, bread, tea, candy, soap, coffee, sugar etc.in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more milk, butter, biscuits, eggs, bread, tea, candy, soap, coffee, sugar etc. 
He describes himself as a friendly man whose dreams are to improve his business and continue to educate his child.

loans.use: To buy more stock for grocery/general store

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene un hijo; es propietario de un vehiculo con el cual trabaja en transporte libre con cuyos  ingresos mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar motor, llantas y reparar algunas fallas de su movilidad y esta manera ponerla en buenas condiciones para no perder estos ingresos ya que es su única fuente de ingresos

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro pero por el carácter social puede acceder al mismo.
texts.en:
Félix lives in his in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Alto San Pedro area.  He is married and has a son.  He owns a vehicle with which he provides taxi services.  Income from this activity supports his family.

The loan is needed to buy a motor and tires and to repair some mechanical problems the car is having so that it can be in good condition and not lose income because this is his only source of income.

This is his first loan request from Impro and due to the social nature he qualifies for same.

loans.use: To buy a motor and tires and for repair of his passenger transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Esteban vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad los cuales están en edad escolar, esta casado y trabaja en el periódico de la ciudad, donde percibe un sueldo con el cual mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar un mueble de computadora y darle comodidad a sus hijos para que tengan un lugar de estudios.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro pero por el carácter social y el análisis económico puede acceder al mismo.
texts.en:
Esteban lives in his own house in La Paz’s Alto San Pedro area.  He has two children who are 7 and 4 years of age and of school age.  He is married and employed by the city’s newspaper where he earns a salary with which he supports his family.

The loan is to buy a desk for a computer so that his children will have a comfortable place to do their school work.

This is his first loan request from Impro.  The social character and economic analysis done makes him eligible for it.

loans.use: To buy a computer desk for his children.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel R. O. tiene 5 años de dedicarse ala siembra de maíz, el lo vende a un soda que vende todo tipo de comidas típicas basadas en maíz costarricenses.
Es el de Santa Fe de Alajuela, una comunidad conocida especialmente por su cercanía a la Frontera con Nicaragua.
El necesita preparar la huerta que tiene detrás de su casa para la próxima cosecha de maíz, es por eso que necesita un préstamo ¢603000 (seiscientos tres mil colones) para comprar todos los insumos necesarios. Espero mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y la de sus 6 hijos.
El tiene 46 años y es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Noel R. O. has been farming corn for 5 years. He sells it to a soda (a small restaurant in Costa Rica) which sells typical dishes made with Costa Rican corn.

He is from Santa Fe de Alajuela, a community especially known for being close to the Nicaraguan border.
He needs to prepare the garden behind his house for the next corn harvest. For this reason, he needs a loan of 603,000 colones (six hundred and 7 thousand colones) to buy all the necessary supplies. He hopes to improve the quality of life for his wife and their 6 children. He is 46 years old and he is a member of  Santa Fe community bank, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: for harvesting corn

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida M. Gonzales  quiere hacer de su Tienda de frutas la mejor de su comunidad.
 Ella vive en una comunidad llamada Santa fe de Alajuela, es conocida por ser una bella zona montañosa a tan solo 30 minutos de Nicaragua.
Ella tiene un negocio pequeño, una Frutería donde vende todo tipo de frutas, pero el negocio aun es muy pequeño, es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo de ¢603 000 (seiscientos tres mil colones)  para la compra de mas fruta de la temporada como pinol, Vainilla y frambuesa, pero sobre todo para comprar una cámara de enfriamiento para conservar más tiempo las frutas.
Ella tiene 52 años y es socia de la Empresa de Credito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y la ECC que tiene mas créditos con KIVA.
texts.en:
Zaida M. Gonzales wants her fruit shop to be the best in her community.  She lives in a community called Santa Fe de Alajuela that’s famous for being a beautiful mountain zone just 30 minutes from Nicaragua.

She has a small fruit shop where she sells all kinds of fruit but the business is still pretty small.  She is, therefore, asking for a 603000 colon loan to buy more seasonal fruit like vanilla and raspberries but most of all to buy a cooler so that she can preserve her fruits longer.

She is 52 years old and a member of the Santa Fe communal bank, one of EDESA’s 100 organizations in Costa Rica and the communal bank with the most KIVA loans.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit and a cooler.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel R. Hernández quiere tener la mejor cosecha de maíz este año,  para darle a su familia la navidad que se merecen.
El es de una comunidad llamada Santa fe de Alajuela, es conocida por ser una bella zona montañosa a tan solo 30 minutos de Nicaragua.
 El tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la siembra y producción de maíz. Hace poco adquirió un pequeño terreno  el cual quiere preparar para la siembre de maíz, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de ¢603 000 (seiscientos tres mil colones) para la compra de insumos para prepara el suelo de su finca y tener la mejor cosecha de este año.
El tiene 59 años y es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y la ECC con más créditos de Kiva
texts.en:
Fidel R. Hernández wants to have the best corn harvest this year to give his family the Christmas they deserve.

He is from a community called Santa Fe de Alajuela famous for being a beautiful, mountainous area just 30 minutes from Nicaragua.

He has been a corn farmer for four years.  A short while ago he acquired a small field that he wants to prepare to plant corn.  This is why he needs a 603 000 colon loan to buy supplies to prepare the soil on his farm in order to have the best harvest this year.

He is 59 years old and a member of the Santa Fe communal bank, one of EDESA’s 100 organizations in Costa Rica and the communal bank with the most KIVA loans.

loans.use: For corn crops.

loans.name: Angel  Neftali

texts.es: El Sr. F. labora como empleado en una empresa desde hace mas de un año, su esposa tambien es empleada de otra institucion. Son un matrimonio joven con 2 hijos a los que le quieren dar un mejor nivel de vida, el Sr. tiene 15 años viviendo en el domicilio que le dejaron sus padres, como ya es una casa algo deteriorada le quiere dar un mejor aspecto y a base de esfuerzos ofrecerle un hogar comodo y agradable a sus hijos ya que todo lo hacen pensando en ellos. Es por eso que requieren de este prestamo para pintar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernández has been employed at a firm for over a year.  His wife is also employed at another institution.  They are a young couple with two children who want to provide a better standard of living.

He has been living in a home his parents passed on to him for 15 years.  Because it’s pretty deteriorated he wants to improve its appearance and through his efforts provide a comfortable, pleasant home for his children.  Everything he and his wife do is with their children in mind.  

They need this loan in order to paint their house.

loans.use: To paint his house.

loans.name: Tieblé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tieblé C. est un homme marié de 26 ans et sans enfant. Il vit avec sa femme dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Depuis à l’âge de 8 ans il suivait son père dans son atelier de couture. C’est d’ailleurs auprès de celui là qu’il appris la couture. Avec le décès de son père il est devenu le chef de l’atelier. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité. Son atelier est situé dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Dans le souci de mieux rentabiliser son activité de couture, il décida d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, un important lot de matériels pour son atelier de couture (aiguilles, papier, tissus, files etc). Il s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes.
Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement bien remboursé. 
Il envisage  toujours bien rembourser ses prêts afin de maintenir la confiance. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Tieblé C., 26 years old, is married without children. He lives with his wife in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. Not having gone to a modern school, he started earning a living very early on. Since he was eight, he helped out his father in the sewing shop. It is from his father that Mr. C. has learned this trade. When his father passed away, Mr. C. became the owner of the sewing shop. With over 10 years of experience, he knows his trade well. His shop is located in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. In order to make his business more profitable, he decided to turn to the credit program of Soro Yriwaso in order to purchase a big lot of supplies for his shop (needles, paper, fabric, thread etc). He purchases his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako.

He is now on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having properly repaid the previous loan. He plans to continue repaying his loans properly  so as to maintain [the organization's] trust. His customers come from the local population. He plans to achieve a monthly income of 32,000 West African Francs.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for his sewing shop

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Madame Fanta Kanté est  une femme mariée de 49 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Madame Fanta Kanté a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. Elle a tenté pendant des années différentes activités  telles  la vente des jus de fruits, de cosmétiques mais sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida d’apprendre auprès de sa sœur la vente des pagnes wax,  de bazins et  de chaussures.
Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, elle maîtrise son activité.
Après 12 prêts  solidaires, elle décide de passer au prêt  individuel où elle est à son premier prêt. Tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Fanta Kanté compte utiliser ce premier individuel pour acheter,  des pièces pagnes wax et quelques pièces de bazins (riches et moins riches). Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes.
Sa clientèle est composée pour la plupart de femmes. Elle vend généralement au comptant.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Elle  ambitionne ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanta Kanté is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She lives with her children in her husband’s home in the neighborhood of Torakabougou, in Bougouni.

Mrs. Kanté left school early on to earn a living. Over several years, she attempted various activities such as selling fruit juices, or cosmetics, but without success. She then opted to sell wax pagnes (colorful cloth), bazins (highly-prized damask), and shoes, a trade she learned from her sister. With ten years of experience in this business, she has a good command of her activity. 

After 12 group loans, she decided to seek her first individual loan. All previous loans have been fully repaid. 

Fanta intends to use her first individual to buy pieces of wax pagnes and various grades of bazins. She gets her stocks from Bamako wholesalers. She usually sells for cash to a clientele consisting mostly of women. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 60 000FCFA, and hopes to open a shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing fabrics

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Bintou Traoré est une femme mariée de 48 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus telles la fabrication et vente des jus de fruits devant une école de la place, la vente de pagnes et de savons. Finalement Bintou opta pour la vente de savons  depuis maintenant  plus de 10 ans. Elle est très sollicité et appréciée à Bougouni. 
Ainsi après 8 prêts solidaires, elle décide de venir  au prêt  individuel où elle est à son premier prêt. Tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle en nette croissance, qu’elle décide de continuer à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des cartons des savons de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. La vente se fait dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni, d’une façon ambulante et à domicile, en détail et au comptant.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA. 
Elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise pour devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. Bintou Traoré is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of six children.  She lives with her children at her husband's place in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni.  Having quickly dropped out of school, she decided to operate revenue-generating businesses, such as making and selling fruit juices in front of a local school, selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and selling soaps.  Bintou has been in business for over ten years now.  She is in high demand and much appreciated in Bougouni.  

And so, after eight solidarity loans, Bintou decided to go with individual loans and is now on her first loan.  All the other loans have been correctly repaid. Concerned about further satisfying her customer base, which is clearly growing, she decided to continue to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy boxes of soaps of different kinds.  She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali).  

Her customer base is composed essentially of women. Cash or credit sales are made at home and by going door-to-door in the different districts of Bougouni.  Bintou expects to make a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA.  Her ambition is to expand her enterprise to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: Buying soaps

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEYA est constitué de 2 femmes mariées,1 veuve et 1 célibataire avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans et en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali) 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
MOSSOKORO C. qui est la présidente du groupe BADEYA fait l’achat vente des fruits et légumes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 chargements de charrette en oranges. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et dans les villages voisins auprès des producteurs.
Les oranges sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Badeya group consists of two married women, one widow, and one single woman, who average 32 years of age and two children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in MEDINE, a neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their sixth time collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. All previous loans were properly repaid.

MOSSOKORO C., president of the group, makes a living buying and selling fruit and vegetables. With the loan, she plans to buy three cart loads of oranges. She gets her stocks from fruit growers at the big market and in neighboring villages.

The oranges are sold for cash or credit at the Medine market in Sikasso, and within the family, to a clientele consisting of men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 70 000FCFA to be used for the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy oranges

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “Unidas” está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por   diez  integrantes, 9 mujeres y un varón, esta asociación se reunirá cada quincena.  El verse dos veces al mes les permitirá conocerse y fortalecer los lazos que las une como asociación.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora Evangelina como presidenta, la señora Julia como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Benedicta.

La señora Benedicta es una mujer joven de 28 años de edad, casada, con un solo hijo y ha sido elegida como Secretaria de Actas de la mesa directiva por sus habilidades para el cargo.  Con relación a su negocio, es la venta de muebles, desde hace seis años.  Ella aprendió de su esposo, él tenía el negocio de elaboración de muebles y venta, desde que era soltero.

 Los negocios  que llevan adelante las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son variados: tienda y servicio de teléfono público, venta de carne, venta de comida, costura de cueros, venta de pescados, venta de sopa de fideo, venta de muebles, costura de chamarra macramé, chofer.  Este primer crédito, de la señora Benedicta es por Bs 2000.- y la finalidad es de comprar material para la elaboración de los muebles, es decir madera y venesta. 
Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, responde el apoyo médico.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (United Ones) communal bank is asking for its first loan in the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has ten members, 9 women and one man.  They meet every two weeks.  Meeting twice a month makes it possible for them to know each other better and strengthen the bonds that unite them as an association.  The governing board is composed of:  Evangelina, President, Julia, Treasurer and Benedicta, Recording Secretary.

Benedicta is a young 28 year old, married woman.  She has a son and has been elected Recording Secretary of the governing board thanks to her abilities for the position.  With respect to her business, she has sold furniture for the past six years.  She learned from her husband.  He has had a furniture making and sales business since he was single.

The businesses that the other members of the communal bank have are varied.  There are stores, public telephone service, meat sales, food sales, leather sewing, fish sales, noodle soup sales, furniture sales, macramé jacket making, and a driver.

This is Benedicta’s first, Bs2000, loan.  She will use it to buy supplies to make furniture, that is lumber and venesta (pressed wood).

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers: the medical services.

loans.use: To buy venesta (pressed wood) and lumber.

loans.name: Alahou Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe ALAHOU (6 femmes mariées  et  1 célibataire) ont en moyenne 35 ans, 2 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et le  premier prêt  s’est  bien dénoué. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  des articles divers tels, les oignons, la vente  des chaussures et tissus  avec  Aminata C., la présidente du groupe.
AMINATA C. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  12 colis de chaussures  et 20 pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et les vend en ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The seven  members of the ALAHOU group (6 married women and 1 single woman) are on average 35 years old with 2 children.   Most live in monogamous families at Sanoubougou I, a district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  This is their second loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to satisfy their customers’ needs.  The first loan has been fully repaid.  This group of women sell various items such as onions and sell shoes and fabrics with Aminata C., the group's president. Aminata C. plans to buy 12 boxes of shoes and 20 pagnes (a colorful West African cloth) with her loan. She gets her supplies at the large market and sells them on a cash basis in town and from her home to a clientele composed of men and women.  She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA of which a part will be used to help her husband provide for the family's needs and the remainder will be invested in the business.  Her goal is to increase her sales to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Laure Abajo Group

texts.es:
el grupo Laure Abajo esta ubicado en la aldea Laure Abajo, de ahi el nombre del grupo, esta integrado por tres mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, el credito lo utilizaran para invertirlos en sus negocios, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Saturnina G. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Benicio Baca quien se dedica a la agricultura, no tienen dependientes directos sus hijos ya se casaron todos.
Saturnina se dedica a la venta de frijoles, maiz, azucar, jabon, pollo, refrescos, churros, etc. tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion. hace 4 años inicio con su negocio en donde a tenido buenas y malas experiencias con sus clientes.

la sra. Marlen Lautany P. tiene 33 años de edad y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, Marlen se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, refrescos, pollo frito. durante las tardes y los fines de semana. 
Su mayor anhelo es que su familia este bien y que sus ventas se mejoren para tener mejores ganancias y asi cubrir con todas las necesidades de su hogar.

Glenda Marilin L. P. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre señor Heriberto Mendez,  no tienen dependientes.
Gloria se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia desde hace 3 años.
su deseo es quedar embarazada en estos meses que vienen.
texts.en:
